40001001	The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ , the son of David , the son of Abraham .
40001002	Abraham became the father of Isaac , and Isaac became the father of Jacob , and Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers ,
40001003	and Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar , and Perez became the father of Hezron , and Hezron became the father of Aram ,
40001004	and Aram became the father of Amminadab , and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon , and Nahshon became the father of Salmon ,
40001005	and Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab , and Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth , and Obed became the father of Jesse ,
40001006	and Jesse became the father of David the king . And David became the father of Solomon by the wife of Uriah ,
40001007	and Solomon became the father of Rehoboam , and Rehoboam became the father of Abijah , and Abijah became the father of Asa ,
40001008	and Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat , and Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram , and Joram became the father of Uzziah ,
40001009	and Uzziah became the father of Jotham , and Jotham became the father of Ahaz , and Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah ,
40001010	and Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh , and Manasseh became the father of Amon , and Amon became the father of Josiah ,
40001011	and Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers , at the time of the deportation to Babylon .
40001012	And after the deportation to Babylon , Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel , and Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel ,
40001013	and Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud , and Abiud became the father of Eliakim , and Eliakim became the father of Azor ,
40001014	and Azor became the father of Zadok , and Zadok became the father of Achim , and Achim became the father of Eliud ,
40001015	and Eliud became the father of Eleazar , and Eleazar became the father of Matthan , and Matthan became the father of Jacob ,
40001016	and Jacob became the father of Joseph , the husband of Mary by whom was born Jesus , who is called Christ .
40001017	Therefore all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations , and from David to the deportation to Babylon are fourteen generations , and from the deportation to Babylon to the Christ are fourteen generations .
40001018	Now the birth of Jesus Christ occurred in this way . His mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph , but before they came together , she was found ˻ to be pregnant ˼ by the Holy Spirit .
40001019	So Joseph her husband , being righteous and not wanting to disgrace her , intended to divorce her secretly .
40001020	But as he was considering these things , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream , saying , “ Joseph , son of David , do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife , for what has been conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit .
40001021	And she will give birth to a son , and you will call his name ‘ Jesus , ’ because he will save his people from their sins . ”
40001022	Now all this happened in order that what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet would be fulfilled , saying ,
40001023	“ Behold , the virgin ˻ will become pregnant ˼ and will give birth to a son , and they will call his name Emmanuel , ” which is translated , “ God with us . ”
40001024	And Joseph , when he woke up from sleep , did as the angel of the Lord commanded him , and he took his wife
40001025	and ˻ did not have sexual relations with ˼ her until she gave birth to a son . And he called his name Jesus .
40002001	Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king , behold , wise men from the east came to Jerusalem ,
40002002	saying , “ Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews ? For we have seen his star at its rising and have come to worship him . ”
40002003	And when King Herod heard it , he was troubled , and all Jerusalem with him ,
40002004	and after calling together all the chief priests and scribes of the people , he inquired from them where the Christ was to be born .
40002005	So they said to him , “ In Bethlehem of Judea , for thus it is written by the prophet ,
40002006	‘ And you , Bethlehem , land of Judah , are by no means least among the rulers of Judah , for from you will go out a rulerwho will shepherd my people Israel . ’ ”
40002007	Then Herod secretly summoned the wise men and determined precisely from them the time when the star appeared .
40002008	And he sent them to Bethlehem and said , “ Go , inquire carefully concerning the child , and when you have found him , report to me so that I also may come and worship him . ”
40002009	After they listened to the king , they went out , and behold , the star which they had seen at its rising led them until it came and stood above the place where the child was .
40002010	Now when they saw the star , they rejoiced with very great joy .
40002011	And when they came into the house , they saw the child with Mary his mother , and they fell down and worshiped him . And opening their treasure boxes , they offered him gifts of gold and frankincense and myrrh .
40002012	And being warned in a dream not to return to Herod , they went back to their own country by another route .
40002013	Now after they had gone away , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph , saying , “ Get up , take the child and his mother and flee to Egypt , and stay there until I tell you . For Herod is about to seek the child to destroy him . ”
40002014	So he got up and took the child and his mother during the night and went away to Egypt .
40002015	And he was there until the death of Herod , in order that what was said by the Lord through the prophet would be fulfilled , saying , “ Out of Egypt I called my son . ”
40002016	Then Herod , when he saw that he had been deceived by the wise men , became very angry , and he sent soldiersand executed all the children in Bethlehem and in all the region around it from the age of two years old and under , according to the time which he had determined precisely from the wise men .
40002017	Then what was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled , saying ,
40002018	“ A voice was heard in Ramah , weeping and great mourning , Rachel weeping for her children , and she did not want to be comforted , because ˻ they exist no longer ˼ . ”
40002019	Now after Herod had died , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt ,
40002020	saying , “ Get up , take the child and his mother and go to the land of Israel , for those who were seeking the life of the child are dead . ”
40002021	So he got up and took the child and his mother and ˻ entered ˼ the land of Israel .
40002022	But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod , he was afraid to go there , and being warned in a dream , he took refuge in the regions of Galilee .
40002023	And he came and lived in a town called Nazareth , in order that what was said by the prophets would be fulfilled : “ He will be called a Nazarene . ”
40003001	Now in those days John the Baptist came preaching in the Judean wilderness
40003002	and saying , “ Repent , for the kingdom of heaven has come near ! ”
40003003	For this is the one who was spoken about by the prophet Isaiah , saying , “ The voice of one crying out in the wilderness , ‘ Prepare the way of the Lord , make his paths straight . ’ ”
40003004	Now John himself had his clothing made from camel’s hair and a belt made of leather around his waist , and his food was locusts and wild honey .
40003005	Then Jerusalem and all Judea and all the district around the Jordan were going out to him ,
40003006	and they were being baptized by him in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins .
40003007	But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism , he said to them , “ Offspring of vipers ! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath ?
40003008	Therefore produce fruit worthy of repentence !
40003009	And do not think to say to yourselves , ‘ We have Abraham as father . ’ For I say to you that God is able to raise up children for Abraham from these stones !
40003010	Already now the ax is positioned at the root of the trees ; therefore every tree not producing good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire .
40003011	I baptize you with water for repentence , but the one who comes after me is more powerful than I am , whose sandals I am not worthy to carry . He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire .
40003012	His winnowing shovel is in his hand , and he will clean out his threshing floor and will gather his wheat into the storehouse , but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire . ”
40003013	Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John in order to be baptized by him .
40003014	But John tried to prevent him , saying , “ ˻ I need ˼ to be baptized by you , and do you come to me ? ”
40003015	But Jesus answered and said to him , “ Permit it now , for in this way it is right for us to fulfill all righteousness . ” Then he permitted him .
40003016	Now after he was baptized , Jesus immediately went up from the water , and behold , the heavens opened to him and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming upon him .
40003017	And behold , there was a voice from heaven saying , “ This is my beloved Son , with whom I am well pleased . ”
40004001	Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted by the devil ,
40004002	and after he had fasted forty days and forty nights , then he was hungry .
40004003	And the tempter approached and said to him , “ If you are the Son of God , order that these stones become bread . ”
40004004	But he answered and said , “ It is written , ‘ Man will not live on bread alone , but on every word that comes out of the mouth of God . ”
40004005	Then the devil took him to the holy city and placed him on the highest point of the temple
40004006	and said to him , “ If you are the Son of God , throw yourself down ! For it is written , ‘ He will command his angels concerning you , ’ and ‘ On their hands they will lift you up , lest you strike your foot against a stone . ’ ”
40004007	Jesus said to him , “ On the other hand it is written , ‘ You are not to put the Lord your God to the test . ’ ”
40004008	Again the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory ,
40004009	and he said to him , “ I will give to you all these things , if you will fall down and worship me . ”
40004010	Then Jesus said to him , “ Go away , Satan , for it is written , ‘ You shall worship the Lord your God and serve only him . ’ ”
40004011	Then the devil left him , and behold , angels came and began ministering to him .
40004012	Now when he heard that John ˻ had been arrested ˼ , he withdrew into Galilee .
40004013	And leaving Nazareth , he went and lived in Capernaum by the sea , in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali ,
40004014	in order that what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled , who said ,
40004015	“ Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali , ˻ toward the sea ˼ , on the other side of the Jordan , Galilee of the Gentiles —
40004016	the people who sit in darknesshave seen a great light , and the ones who sit in the land and shadow of death , a light has dawned on them . ”
40004017	From that time on , Jesus began to preach and to say , “ Repent , because the kingdom of heaven is near . ”
40004018	Now as he was walking beside the Sea of Galilee , he saw two brothers , Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew , throwing a casting net into the sea ( for they were fishermen ) .
40004019	And he said to them , “ ˻ Follow me ˼ and I will make you fishers of people . ”
40004020	And immediately they left their nets and followed him .
40004021	And going on from there , he saw two other brothers , James the son of Zebedee and his brother John , in the boat with their father Zebedee , mending their nets , and he called them .
40004022	And immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him .
40004023	And he went around through all of Galilee , teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and every sickness among the people .
40004024	And a report about him went out ˻ throughout ˼ Syria , and they brought to him all those ˻ who were sick ˼ with various diseases and afflicted by torments and demon-possessed and epileptics and paralytics , and he healed them .
40004025	And large crowds followed him from Galilee , Decapolis , Jerusalem , Judea , and from the other side of the Jordan .
40005001	Now when he saw the crowds , he went up the mountain and after he sat down , his disciples approached him .
40005002	And opening his mouth he began to teach them , saying ,
40005003	“ Blessed are the poor in spirit , because theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40005004	Blessed are the ones who mourn , because they will be comforted .
40005005	Blessed are the meek , because they will inherit the earth .
40005006	Blessed are the ones who hunger and thirst for righteousness , because they will be satisfied .
40005007	Blessed are the merciful , because they will be shown mercy .
40005008	Blessed are the pure in heart , because they will see God .
40005009	Blessed are the peacemakers , because they will be called sons of God .
40005010	Blessed are those who are persecuted because of righteousness , because theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40005011	Blessed are youwhen they insult you and persecute you and say all kinds of evil things against you , lying on account of me .
40005012	Rejoice and be glad , because your reward is great in heaven , for in the same way they persecuted the prophets before you .
40005013	“ You are the salt of the earth . But if salt becomes tasteless , by what will it be made salty ? It is good for nothing any longer except to be thrown outside and trampled under foot by people .
40005014	You are the light of the world . A city located on top of a hill cannot be hidden ,
40005015	nor do they light a lamp and place it under a basket , but on a lampstand , and it shines on all those in the house .
40005016	In the same way let your light shine before people , so that they can see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven .
40005017	“ Do not think that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets . I have not come to destroy them but to fulfill them .
40005018	For truly I say to you , until heaven and earth pass away , not one tiny letter or one stroke of a letter will pass away from the law until all takes place .
40005019	Therefore whoever abolishes one of the least of these commandments and teaches people to do so will be called least in the kingdom of heaven , but whoever keeps them and teaches them , this person will be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
40005020	For I say to you that unless your righteousness greatly surpasses that of the scribes and Pharisees , you will never enter into the kingdom of heaven .
40005021	“ You have heard that it was said to the ˻ people of old ˼ , ‘ Do not commit murder , ’ and ‘ whoever commits murder will be subject to judgment . ’
40005022	But I say to you that everyone who is angry at his brother will be subject to judgment , and whoever says to his brother , ‘ Stupid fool ! ’ will be subject to the council , and whoever says , ‘ Obstinate fool ! ’ will be subject to fiery hell .
40005023	Therefore if you present your gift at the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you ,
40005024	leave your gift there before the altar and first go be reconciled to your brother , and then come and present your gift .
40005025	˻ Settle the case quickly with your accuser ˼ while you are with him on the way , lest your accuser hand you over to the judge , and the judge to the officer , and you be thrown into prison .
40005026	Truly I say to you , you will never come out of there until you have paid back the last penny !
40005027	“ You have heard that it was said , ‘ Do not commit adultery . ’
40005028	But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman to lust for her has already committed adultery with her in his heart .
40005029	And if your right eye causes you to sin , tear it out and throw it from you ! For it is better for you that one of your members be destroyed than your whole body be thrown into hell .
40005030	And if your right hand causes you to sin , cut it off and throw it from you ! For it is better for you that one of your limbs be destroyed than your whole body go into hell .
40005031	“ And it was said , ‘ Whoever divorces his wife must give her a certificate of divorce . ’
40005032	But I say to you that everyone who divorces his wife , except for a matter of sexual immorality , causes her to commit adultery , and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery .
40005033	“ Again you have heard that it was said to the ˻ people of old ˼ , ‘ Do not swear falsely , but fulfill your oaths to the Lord . ’
40005034	But I say to you , do not swear at all , either by heaven , because it is the throne of God ,
40005035	or by the earth , because it is the footstool of his feet , or by Jerusalem , because it is the city of the great king .
40005036	And do not swear by your head , because you are not able to make one hair white or black .
40005037	But let your statement be ‘ Yes , yes ; no , no , ’ and anything beyond these is from the evil one .
40005038	“ You have heard that it was said , ‘ An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth . ’
40005039	But I say to you , do not resist the evildoer , but whoever strikes you on your right cheek , turn the other to him also .
40005040	And the one who wants to go to court with you and take your tunic , ˻ let him have ˼ your outer garment also .
40005041	And whoever forces you to go one mile , go with him two .
40005042	Give to the one who asks you , and do not turn away from the one who wants to borrow from you .
40005043	“ You have heard that it was said , ‘ Love your neighbor’ and ‘ Hate your enemy . ’
40005044	But I say to you , love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you ,
40005045	in order that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven , because he causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good , and he sends rain on the just and the unjust .
40005046	For if you love those who love you , what reward do you have ? Do not the tax collectors also do the same ?
40005047	And if you greet only your brothers , what are you doing that is remarkable ? Do not the Gentiles also do the same ?
40005048	Therefore you be perfect as your heavenly Father is perfect .
40006001	“ And take care not to practice your righteousness before people to be seen by them ; ˻ otherwise ˼ you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven .
40006002	Therefore whenever you practice charitable giving , do not sound a trumpet in front of you , as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets , in order that they may be praised by people . Truly I say to you , they have received their reward in full !
40006003	But you , when you practice charitable giving , do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing ,
40006004	in order that your charitable giving may be in secret , and your Father who sees in secret will reward you .
40006005	And whenever you pray , do not be like the hypocrites , because they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the corners of the streets , in order that they may be seen by people . Truly I say to you , they have received their reward in full !
40006006	But whenever you pray , enter into your inner room and shut your door and pray to your Father who is in secret , and your Father who sees in secret will reward you .
40006007	“ But when you pray , do not babble repetitiously like the pagans , for they think that because of their many words they will be heard .
40006008	Therefore do not be like them , for your Father knows ˻ what you need ˼ before you ask him .
40006009	Therefore you pray in this way : “ Our Father who is in heaven , may your name be treated as holy .
40006010	May your kingdom come , may your will be doneon earth as it is in heaven .
40006011	Give us today our daily bread ,
40006012	and forgive us our debts , as we also have forgiven our debtors .
40006013	And do not bring us into temptation , but deliver us from the evil one .
40006014	For if you forgive people their sins , your heavenly Father will also forgive you .
40006015	But if you do not forgive people , neither will your Father forgive your sins .
40006016	“ Whenever you fast , do not be sullen like the hypocrites , for they make their faces unrecognizable in order that they may be seen fasting by people . Truly I say to you , they have received their reward in full !
40006017	But when you are fasting , ˻ put olive oil on your head ˼ and wash your face
40006018	so that you will not be seen by people as fasting , but to your Father who is in secret , and your Father who sees in secret will reward you .
40006019	“ Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth , where moth and consuming insect destroy and where thieves break in and steal ,
40006020	but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor consuming insect destroy and where thieves do not break in or steal .
40006021	For where your treasure is , there your heart will be also .
40006022	“ The eye is the lamp of the body . Therefore if your eye is sincere , your whole body will be full of light .
40006023	But if your eye is evil , your whole body will be dark . Therefore if the light in you is darkness , how great is the darkness !
40006024	“ No one is able to serve two masters . For either he will hate the one and love the other , or he will be devoted to one and despise the other . You are not able to serve God and money .
40006025	“ For this reason I say to you , do not be anxious for your life , what you will eat or what you will drink , and not for your body , what you will wear . Is your life not more than food and your body more than clothing ?
40006026	Consider the birds of the sky , that they do not sow or reap or gather produce into barns , and your heavenly Father feeds them . Are you not worth more than they are ?
40006027	And who among you , by being anxious , is able to add one hour to his life span ?
40006028	And why are you anxious about clothing ? Observe the lilies of the field , how they grow : they do not toil or spin ,
40006029	but I say to you that not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed like one of these .
40006030	But if God dresses the grass of the field in this way , although it is here today and tomorrow is thrown into the oven , will he not do so much more for you , you of little faith ?
40006031	Therefore do not be anxious , saying , ‘ What will we eat ? ’ or ‘ What will we drink ? ’ or ‘ What will we wear ? , ’
40006032	for the pagans seek after all these things . For your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things .
40006033	But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness , and all these things will be added to you .
40006034	Therefore do not be anxious for tomorrow , because tomorrow will be anxious for itself . ˻ Each day has enough trouble of its own . ˼
40007001	“ Do not judge , so that you will not be judged .
40007002	For by what judgment you judge , you will be judged , and by what measure you measure out , it will be measured out to you .
40007003	And why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye , but do not notice the beam of wood in your own eye ?
40007004	Or how will you say to your brother , ‘ Allow me to remove the speck from your eye , ’ and behold , the beam of wood is in your own eye ?
40007005	Hypocrite ! First remove the beam of wood from your own eye and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye !
40007006	“ Do not give what is holy to dogs , or throw your pearls in front of pigs , lest they trample them with their feet , and turn around and tear you to pieces .
40007007	“ Ask and it will be given to you ; seek and you will find ; knock and it will be opened for you .
40007008	For everyone who asks receives , and the one who seeks finds , and to the one who knocks it will be opened .
40007009	Or what man is there among you , if his son will ask him for bread , will give him a stone ?
40007010	Or also if he will ask for a fish , will give him a snake ?
40007011	Therefore if you , although you are evil , know how to give good gifts to your children , how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him ?
40007012	Therefore in all things , whatever you want that people should do to you , thus also you do to them . For this is the law and the prophets .
40007013	“ Enter through the narrow gate , because broad is the gate and spacious is the road that leads to destruction , and there are many who enter through it .
40007014	How narrow is the gate and constricted the road that leads to life , and there are few who find it !
40007015	“ Beware of false prophets who come to you in sheep’s clothing , but inside are ravenous wolves .
40007016	You will recognize them by their fruits : they do not gather grapes from thorn bushes or figs from thistles , do they ?
40007017	In the same way , every good tree produces good fruit , but a bad tree produces bad fruit .
40007018	A good tree is not able to produce bad fruit , nor a bad tree to produce good fruit .
40007019	Every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire .
40007020	As a result , you will recognize them by their fruits .
40007021	“ Not everyone who says to me , ‘ Lord , Lord , ’ will enter into the kingdom of heaven , but the one who does the will of my Father who is in heaven .
40007022	On that day many will say to me , ‘ Lord , Lord , did we not prophesy in your name , and expel demons in your name , and perform many miracles in your name ? ’
40007023	And then ˻ I will say to them plainly ˼ , ‘ I never knew you . Depart from me , you who practice lawlessness ! ’
40007024	“ Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock .
40007025	And the rain came down and the rivers came and the winds blew and beat against that house , and it did not collapse , because its foundation was laid on the rock .
40007026	And everyone who hears these words of mine and does not do them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand .

40008005	Now when he entered Capernaum , a centurion approached him , appealing to him

40008014	And when Jesus came into Peter’s house , he saw his mother-in-law lying down and suffering with a fever .

41015007	And the one named Barabbas was imprisoned with the rebels who had committed murder in the rebellion .

42001001	Since many have attempted to compile an account concerning the events that have been fulfilled among us ,
42001002	just as those who were eyewitnesses and servants of the word from the beginning passed on to us ,
42001003	it seemed best to me also — because I have followed all things carefully from the beginning — to write them down in orderly sequence for you , most excellent Theophilus ,
42001004	so that you may know the certainty concerning the things about which you were taught .
42001005	It happened that in the days of Herod , king of Judea , there was a certain priest , Zechariah by name , of the division of Abijah . And ˻ he had a wife ˼ from the daughters of Aaron , and her name was Elizabeth .
42001006	And they were both righteous in the sight of God , living blamelessly in all the commandments and regulations of the Lord .
42001007	And ˻ they did not have ˼ a child , because Elizabeth was barren . And they were both advanced ˻ in years ˼ .
42001008	And it happened that while he was serving as priest before God in the order of his division ,
42001009	according to the custom of the priesthood he was chosen by lot to enter into the temple of the Lord to burn incense .
42001010	And the whole crowd of the people were praying outside at the hour of the incense offering .
42001011	And an angel of the Lord appeared to him , standing at the right side of the altar of incense .
42001012	And Zechariah was terrified when he saw the angel , and fear fell upon him .
42001013	But the angel said to him , “ Do not be afraid , Zechariah , because your prayer has been heard , and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son , and you will call his name John .
42001014	And ˻ you will experience joy and exultation ˼ , and many will rejoice at his birth .
42001015	For he will be great in the sight of the Lord , and he must never drink wine or beer , and he will be filled with the Holy Spiritwhile he is still in his mother’s womb .
42001016	And he will turn many of the sons of Israelto the Lord their God .
42001017	And he will go on before himin the spirit and power of Elijah , to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children , and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous , to prepare for the Lord a people made ready . ”
42001018	And Zechariah said to the angel , “ By what will I know this ? For I am an old man , and my wife is advanced ˻ in years ˼ ! ”
42001019	And the angel answered and said to him , “ I am Gabriel , who stands in the presence of God , and I was sent to speak to you and to announce to you this good news .
42001020	And behold , you will be silent and not able to speak until the day these things take place , ˻ because ˼ you did not believe my words , which will be fulfilled in their time . ”
42001021	And the people were waiting for Zechariah , and began to wonder when he was delayed in the temple .
42001022	And when he came out he was not able to speak to them , and they realized that he had seen a vision in the temple . And he kept making signs to them , and remained unable to speak .
42001023	And it happened that when the days of his service came to an end , he went away to his home .
42001024	Now after these days , his wife Elizabeth conceived , and she kept herself in seclusion for five months , saying ,
42001025	“ Thus the Lord has done for me in the days in which he has concerned himself with me , to take away my disgrace among people . ”
42001026	Now in the sixth month , the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town of Galilee ˻ named ˼ Nazareth ,

42001029	But she was greatly perplexed at the statement , and was pondering what sort of greeting this might be .
42001030	And the angel said to her , “ Do not be afraid , Mary , for you have found favor with God .

43003030	It is necessary for that one to increase , but for me to decrease . ”
43003031	The one who comes from above is over all . The one who is from the earth is from the earth and speaks from the earth ; the one who comes from heaven is over all .
43003032	What he has seen and heard , this he testifies , and no one accepts his testimony .
43003033	The one who accepts his testimony has attested that God is true .

43003035	The Father loves the Son and has given all things into his hand .
43003036	The one who believes in the Son has eternal life , but the one who disobeys the Son will not see life — but the wrath of God remains on him .
43004001	Now when Jesus knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John

43004006	And Jacob’s well was there , so Jesus , because he had become tired from the journey , simply sat down at the well . It was about the sixth hour .
43004007	A woman of Samaria came to draw water . Jesus said to her , “ Give me water to drink . ”
43004008	( For his disciples had gone away into the town so that they could buy food . )
43004009	So the Samaritan woman said to him , “ How do you , being a Jew , ask from me water to drink , since I am a Samaritan woman ? ” ( For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans . )
43004010	Jesus answered and said to her , “ If you had known the gift of God and who it is who says to you , ‘ Give me water to drink , ’ you would have asked him , and he would have given you living water . ”
43004011	The woman said to him , “ Sir , you have no bucket and the well is deep ! From where then do you get this living water ?
43004012	You are not greater than our father Jacob , are you , who gave us the well and drank from it himself , and his sons and his livestock ? ”
43004013	Jesus answered and said to her , “ Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again .
43004014	But whoever drinks of this water which I will give to him will never be thirsty for eternity , but the water which I will give to him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life . ”
43004015	The woman said to him , “ Sir , give me this water , so that I will not be thirsty or come here to draw water ! ”
43004016	He said to her , “ Go , call your husband and come here . ”
43004017	The woman answered and said to him , “ I do not have a husband . ” Jesus said to her , “ You have said rightly , ‘ I do not have a husband , ’

43004027	And at this point his disciples came , and they were astonished that he was speaking with a woman . However , no one said , “ What do you seek ? ” or “ Why are you speaking with her ? ”
43004028	So the woman left her water jar and went away into the town and said to the people ,

43004030	They went out from the town and were coming to him .
43004031	In the meanwhile the disciples were asking him , saying , “ Rabbi , eat something ! ”

43004036	The one who reaps receives wages and gathers fruit for eternal life , in order that the one who sows and the one who reaps can rejoice together .

43005001	After these thingsthere was a feast of the Jews , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem .

43005032	There is another who testifies about me , and I know that the testimony which he testifies about me is true .

43005034	( And I do not receive testimony from people , but I say these things in order that you may be saved . )

43006005	˻ Then Jesus , when he looked up ˼ and saw that a large crowd was coming to him , said to Philip , “ Where can we buy bread so that these people can eat ? ”

43019024	So they said to one another , “ Let us not tear it apart , but cast lots for it , to see whose it will be , ” so that the scripture would be fulfilled that says , “ They divided my garments among themselves , and for my clothing they cast lots . ” Thus the soldiers did these things .
43019025	Now his mother and the sister of his mother , Mary the wife of Clopas , and Mary Magdalene were standing near the cross of Jesus .
43019026	So Jesus , seeing his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing there , said to his mother , “ Woman , behold your son ! ”
43019027	Then he said to the disciple , “ Behold your mother ! ” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own home .
43019028	After this , Jesus , knowing that now at last everything was completed , in order that the scripture would be fulfilled , said , “ I am thirsty . ”
43019029	A jar full of sour wine was standing there , so they put a sponge full of the sour wine on a branch of hyssop and brought it to his mouth .
43019030	Then when he had received the sour wine , Jesus said , “ It is completed , ” and bowing his head , he gave up his spirit .
43019031	Then the Jews , because it was the day of preparation , so that the bodies would not remain on the cross on the Sabbath ( for that Sabbath was an important day ) , asked Pilate that their legs could be broken and they could be taken away .
43019032	So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who had been crucified with him .
43019033	But when they came to Jesus , after they saw he was already dead , they did not break his legs .
43019034	But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear , and blood and water came out immediately .
43019035	And the one who has seen it has testified , and his testimony is true , and that person knows that he is telling the truth , so that you also may believe .
43019036	For these things happened in order that the scripture would be fulfilled : “ Not a bone of his will be broken . ”
43019037	And again another scripture says , “ They will look on the one whom they have pierced . ”
43019038	And after these things , Joseph who was from Arimathea , who was a disciple of Jesus ( but a secret one for fear of the Jews ) , asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus . And Pilate allowed it , so he came and took away his body .
43019039	And Nicodemus — the one who had come to him formerly at night — also came , bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about a hundred pounds .
43019040	So they took the body of Jesus and wrapped it in strips of linen cloth with the fragrant spices , as is the Jews’ custom to prepare for burial .
43019041	Now there was a garden at the place where he was crucified , and in the garden a new tomb in which no one was yet buried .
43019042	So there , on account of the day of preparation of the Jews , because the tomb was close by , they buried Jesus .
43020001	Now on the first day of the week , Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early , while it was still dark , and saw the stone had been taken away from the tomb .
43020002	So she ran and came to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved and said to them , “ They have taken away the Lord from the tomb and we do not know where they have put him ! ”
43020003	Then Peter and the other disciple went out and were going to the tomb .
43020004	And the two were running together , and the other disciple ran ahead , faster than Peter , and came to the tomb first .

43020024	Now Thomas , one of the twelve , who was called Didymus , was not with them when Jesus came .
43020025	So the other disciples said to him , “ We have seen the Lord ! ” But he said to them , “ Unless I see in his hands the mark of the nails , and put my finger into the mark of the nails , and put my hand into his side , I will never believe ! ”

43021001	After these things Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples by the Sea of Tiberias . Now he revealed himself in this way :
43021002	Simon Peter and Thomas ( who was called Didymus ) and Nathanael from Cana in Galilee and the sons of Zebedee and two others of his disciples were together .
43021003	Simon Peter said to them , “ I am going fishing ! ” They said to him , “ We also are coming with you . ” They went out and got into the boat , and during that night they caught nothing .
43021004	Now when it was already early morning , Jesus stood on the beach . However , the disciples did not know that it was Jesus .
43021005	So Jesus said to them , “ Children , you do not have any fish to eat , do you ? They answered him , “ No . ”
43021006	And he said to them , “ Throw the net on the right side of the boat , and you will find some . ” So they threw it , and were no longer able to haul it in from the large number of the fish .
43021007	Then that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter , “ It is the Lord ! ” So Simon Peter , when he heard that it was the Lord , tied around himself his outer garment ( for he was naked ) and threw himself into the sea .
43021008	But the other disciples came in the boat , dragging the net of fish , because they were not far from the land , but about two hundred cubits away .
43021009	So when they got out on the land , they saw a charcoal fire laid there , and a fish lying on it , and bread .
43021010	Jesus said to them , “ Bring some of the fish that you have just now caught . ”
43021011	So Simon Peter got into the boat and hauled the net to the land , full of large fish — one hundred fifty-three — and although there were so many , the net was not torn .
43021012	Jesus said to them , “ Come , eat breakfast ! ” But none of the disciples dared to ask him , “ Who are you ? ” because they knew that it was the Lord .
43021013	Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them , and the fish likewise .
43021014	This was now the third time Jesus was revealed to the disciples after he had been raised from the dead .
43021015	Now when they had eaten breakfast , Jesus said to Simon Peter , “ Simon son of John , do you love me more than these ? ” He said to him , “ Yes , Lord , you know that I love you . ” He said to him , “ Feed my lambs ! ”
43021016	He said to him again a second time , “ Simon son of John , do you love me ? ” He said to him , “ Yes , Lord , you know that I love you . ” He said to him , “ Shepherd my sheep ! ”
43021017	He said to him a third time , “ Simon son of John , do you love me ? ” Peter was distressed because he said to him a third time , “ Do you love me ? ” and he said to him , “ Lord , you know everything ! You know that I love you ! ” Jesus said to him , “ Feed my sheep !
43021018	Truly , truly I say to you , when you were young , you tied your clothes around yourself and walked wherever you wanted . But when you grow old , you will stretch out your hands , and someone else will tie you up and carry you where you do not want to go .
43021019	( Now he said this to indicate by what kind of death he would glorify God . ) And after he had said this , he said to him , “ Follow me ! ”
43021020	Peter turned and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them ( who also leaned back on his chest at the dinner and said , “ Lord , who is the one betraying you ? ” )
43021021	So when he saw this one , Peter said to Jesus , “ Lord , but what about this one ? ”
43021022	Jesus said to him , “ If I want him to remain until I come , what is that to you ? You follow me ! ”
43021023	So this saying went out to the brothers that that disciple would not die . But Jesus did not say to him that he would not die , but “ If I want him to remain until I come , what is that to you ? ”
43021024	This is the disciple who is testifying about these things , and who has written down these things . And we know that his testimony is true .
43021025	Now there are also many other things that Jesus did , which — if they were written down one after the other — I suppose not even the world itself could contain the books that would be written .

44016026	And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken . And immediately all the doors were opened and all the bonds were unfastened .
44016027	And after the jailer was awake and saw the doors of the prison open , he drew his sword and was about to kill himself , because he thought the prisoners had escaped .
44016028	But Paul called out with a loud voice , saying , “ Do no harm to yourself , for we are all here ! ”
44016029	And demanding lights , he rushed in and , ˻ beginning to tremble ˼ , fell down at the feet of Paul and Silas .
44016030	And he brought them outside and said , “ Sirs , what must I do so that I can be saved ? ”
44016031	And they said , “ Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved , you and your household ! ”
44016032	And they spoke the message of the Lord to him , together with all those in his house .
44016033	And he took them at that very hour of the night and washed their wounds , and he himself was baptized at once , and all those of his household .
44016034	And he brought them up into his house and set a meal before them , and rejoiced greatly that he had believed in God with his whole household .
44016035	And when it was day , the chief magistrates sent the police officers , saying , “ Release those men . ”
44016036	And the jailer reported these words to Paul : “ The chief magistrates have sent an order that you should be released . So come out now and go in peace ! ”
44016037	But Paul said to them , “ They beat us in public without due process — men who are Roman citizens — and threw us into prison , and now they are wanting to release us secretly ? Certainly not ! Rather let them come themselves and bring us out ! ”
44016038	So the police officers reported these words to the chief magistrates , and they were afraid when they heard that they were Roman citizens .
44016039	And they came and apologized to them , and after they brought them out they asked them to depart from the city .
44016040	And when they came out of the prison , they went to Lydia and when they saw them , they encouraged the brothers and departed .
44017001	Now after they traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where there was a synagogue of the Jews .
44017002	˻ And as was his custom ˼ , Paul went in to them and on three Sabbath days he discussed with them from the scriptures ,
44017003	explaining and demonstrating that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead , and saying , “ This Jesus whom I am proclaiming to you is the Christ . ”
44017004	And some of them were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas , and also a large number of God-fearing Greeks and not a few of the prominent women .
44017005	But the Jews were filled with jealousy and , taking along some worthless men from the rabble in the marketplace and forming a mob , threw the city into an uproar . And attacking Jason’s house , they were looking for them to bring them out to the popular assembly .
44017006	And when they did not find them , they dragged Jason and some brothers before the city officials , shouting , “ These people who have stirred up trouble throughout the world have come here also ,
44017007	whom Jason has entertained as guests ! And these peopleare all acting contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying there is another king , Jesus ! ”

44017011	Now these were more open-minded than those in Thessalonica . ˻ They ˼ accepted the message with all eagerness , examining the scriptures every day to see if these things were so .

44017015	And those who conducted Paul brought him as far as Athens , and after receiving an order for Silas and Timothy that they should come to him as soon as possible , they went away .
44017016	Now while Paul was waiting for them in Athens , his spirit was provoked within him when he observed the city was full of idols .
44017017	So he was discussing in the synagogue with the Jews and the God-fearing Gentiles , and in the marketplace every day with those who happened to be there .
44017018	And even some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers were conversing with him , and some were saying , “ What does this babbler want to say ? ” But others said , “ He appears to be a proclaimer of foreign deities , ” because he was proclaiming the good news about Jesus and the resurrection .
44017019	And they took hold of him and brought him to the Areopagus , saying , “ May we learn what is this new teaching being proclaimed by you ?
44017020	For you are bringing some astonishing things to our ears . Therefore we want to know what ˻ these things mean ˼ . ”
44017021	( Now all the Athenians and the foreigners who stayed there used to spend their time in nothing else than telling something or listening to something new . )
44017022	So Paul stood there in the middle of the Areopagus and said , “ Men of Athens , I see you are very religious ˻ in every respect ˼ .
44017023	For as I was passing through and observeing carefully your objects of worship , I even found an altar on which was inscribed , ‘ To an unknown God . ’ Therefore what you worship without knowing it , this I proclaim to you —
44017024	the God who made the world and all the things in it . This one , being Lord of heaven and earth , does not live in temples made by human hands ,
44017025	nor is he served by human hands as if he needed anything , because he himself gives to everyone life and breath and everything .
44017026	And he made from one man every nation of humanity to live on all the face of the earth , determining their fixed times and the fixed boundaries of their habitation ,
44017027	to search for God , if perhaps indeed they might feel around for him and find him . And indeed he is not far away from each one of us ,
44017028	for in him we live and move and exist , as even some of ˻ your own ˼ poets have said : ‘ For we also are ˻ his ˼ offspring . ’
44017029	Therefore , because we are offspring of God , we ought not to think the divine being is like gold or silver or stone , an image formed by human skill and thought .
44017030	Therefore although God has overlooked the times of ignorance , he now commands all people everywhere to repent ,
44017031	because he has set a day on which he is going to judge the world in righteousness by the man who he has appointed , having provided proof to everyone by raising him from the dead . ”
44017032	Now when they heard about the resurrection of the dead , some scoffed , but others said , “ We will hear you about this again also . ”

44018020	And when they asked him to stay for a longer time , he did not give his consent ,

44019020	In this way the word of the Lord was growing in power and was prevailing .

44019025	˻ These ˼ he gathered together , and the workers occupied with such things , and said , “ Men , you know that from this business ˻ we get our prosperity ˼ ,

44019027	So not only is there a danger this line of business of ours will come into disrepute , but also the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be regarded as nothing — and she is about to be brought down even from her grandeur , she whom the whole of Asia and the entire world worship ! ”
44019028	And when they heard this and became full of rage , they began to shout , saying , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019029	And the city was filled with the tumult , and with one purpose they rushed into the theater , seizing Gaius and Aristarchus , Macedonians who were traveling companions of Paul .
44019030	But when Paul wanted to enter into the popular assembly , the disciples would not let him .
44019031	And even some of the Asiarchs who were his friends sent word to him and were urging him not to risk himself by going into the theater .
44019032	So some were shouting one thingand some another , for the assembly was in confusion , and the majority did not know ˻ why ˼ they had assembled .
44019033	And some of the crowd advised Alexander , when the Jews put him forward . But Alexander , motioning with his hand , was wanting to defend himself to the popular assembly .
44019034	But when they recognized that he was a Jew , they were shouting with one voice from all of them for about two hours , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019035	And when the city secretary had quieted the crowd , he said , “ Ephesian men , for who is there among men who does not know the Ephesian city is honorary temple keeper of the great Artemis and of her image fallen from heaven ?
44019036	Therefore because these things are undeniable , it is necessary that you be quiet and do nothing rash !
44019037	For you have brought these men herewho are neither temple robbers nor blasphemers of our goddess .

44019039	But if you desire anything further , it will be settled in the lawful assembly .
44019040	For indeed we are in danger of being accused of rioting concerning today , since there is no cause in relation to which we will be able to give an account concerning this disorderly gathering ! ” And when he had said these things , he dismissed the assembly .

44022009	( Now those who were with me saw the light but did not hear the voice of the one who was speaking to me . )

44022014	And he said , ‘ The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will , and to see the Righteous One and to hear a voice from his mouth ,
44022015	because you will be a witness for him to all people of what you have seen and heard .
44022016	And now why are you delaying ? Get up , be baptized , and wash away your sins , calling on his name ! ’
44022017	“ And it happened that when I returned to Jerusalem and I was praying in the temple courts , I was in a trance ,
44022018	and saw him saying to me , ‘ Hurry and depart ˻ quickly ˼ from Jerusalem , because they will not accept your testimony about me . ’
44022019	And I said , ‘ Lord , they themselves know that from synagogue to synagogue I was imprisoning and beating those who believed in you .
44022020	And when the blood of your witness Stephen was being shed , I myself also was standing near and was approving , and was guarding the cloaks of those who were killing him . ’
44022021	And he said to me , ‘ Go , because I will send you far away to the Gentiles ! ’ ”
44022022	Now they were listening to him until this word , and they raised their voices , saying , “ Away with such a man from the earth ! For it is not fitting for him to live ! ”
44022023	And while they were screaming and throwing off their cloaks and throwing dust into the air ,
44022024	the military tribune ordered him to be brought into the barracks , saying he was to be examined with a lash so that he could find out for what reason they were crying out against him in this way .
44022025	But when they had stretched him out for the lash , Paul said to the centurion standing there , “ Is it permitted for you to flog a man who is a Roman citizen and uncondemned ? ”
44022026	And when the centurion heard this , he went to the military tribune and reported it , saying , “ What are you about to do ? For this man is a Roman citizen ! ”
44022027	So the military tribune came and said to him , “ Tell me , are you a Roman citizen ? ” And he said , “ Yes . ”
44022028	And the military tribune replied , “ I acquired this citizenship for a large sum of money . ” And Paul said , “ But I indeed was born a citizen .
44022029	Then immediately those who were about to examine him kept away from him , and the military tribune also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman citizen and that ˻ he had tied him up ˼ .
44022030	But on the next day , because he wanted to know the true reason why he was being accused by the Jews , he released him and ordered the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin to assemble , and he brought down Paul and had him stand before them .
44023001	And looking intently at the Sanhedrin , Paul said , “ Men and brothers , I have lived my life in all good conscience before God to this day . ”
44023002	So the high priest Ananias ordered those standing near him to strike his mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , “ God is going to strike you , you whitewashed wall ! And are you sitting there judging me according to the law , and acting contrary to the law do you order me to be struck ? ”
44023004	And those who stood nearby said , “ Are you reviling the high priest of God ? ”
44023005	And Paul said , “ I did not know , brothers , that he was high priest . For it is written , ‘ You must not speak evil of a ruler of your people . ’ ”
44023006	Now when Paul realized that one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees , he shouted out in the Sanhedrin , “ Men and brothers ! I am a Pharisee , a son of Pharisees ! I am being judged concerning the hope and the resurrection of the dead ! ”
44023007	And when he said this , a dispute developed between the Pharisees and Sadducees , and the assembly was divided .
44023008	( For the Sadducees say there is no resurrection or angel or spirit , but the Pharisees acknowledge them all . )
44023009	And there was loud shouting , and some of the scribes from the party of the Pharisees stood up and contended sharply , saying , “ We find nothing wrong with this man ! But what if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him ? ”
44023010	And when the dispute became severe , the military tribune , fearing lest Paul be torn apart by them , ordered the detachment to go down , take him away from their midst , and bring him into the barracks .
44023011	And the next night the Lord stood by him and said , “ Have courage , for as you have testified about me in Jerusalem , so you must also testify in Rome . ”
44023012	And when it was day , the Jews made a conspiracy and bound themselves under a curse , saying they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul .
44023013	Now there were more than forty who had made this conspiracy ,
44023014	who went to the chief priests and the elders and said , “ We have bound ourselves under a curse to partake of nothing until we have killed Paul .
44023015	Therefore , now you along with the Sanhedrin explain to the military tribune that he should bring him down to you , as if you were going to determine more accurately the things concerning him . And we are ready to do away with him before he comes near . ”
44023016	But when the son of Paul’s sister heard about the ambush , he came and entered into the barracks and reported it to Paul .
44023017	So Paul called one of the centurions and said , “ Bring this young man to the military tribune , because he has something to report to him . ”
44023018	So he took him and brought him to the military tribune and said , “ The prisoner Paul called me and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you . ”
44023019	And the military tribune , taking hold of his hand and withdrawing privately , asked , “ What is it that you have to report to me ? ”
44023020	And he said , “ The Jews have agreed to ask you that you bring Paul down to the Sanhedrin tomorrow , as if they were going to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him .
44023021	You therefore do not be persuaded by them , because more than forty men of ˻ their number ˼ are lying in wait for him , who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have done away with him . And now they are ready , waiting for ˻ you to agree ˼ . ”
44023022	So the military tribune sent the young man away , directing him , “ Tell no one that you have revealed these things to me . ”
44023023	And he summoned two of the centurions and said , “ Make ready from the third hour of the night two hundred soldiers and seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen , in order that they may proceed as far as Caesarea .
44023024	And provide mounts so that they can put Paul on them and bring him safely to Felix the governor . ”
44023025	˻ He wrote ˼ a letter that had this form :
44023026	" Claudius Lysias . To his excellency Governor Felix . Greetings !
44023027	This man was seized by the Jews and was about to be killed by them when I came upon them with the detachment and rescued him , because I learned that he was a Roman citizen .
44023028	And because I wanted to know the charge for which they were accusing him , I brought him down to their Sanhedrin .
44023029	I found ˻ he ˼ was accused concerning controversial questions of their law , but having no charge deserving death or imprisonment .
44023030	And when it was made known to me there would be a plot against the man , I sent him to you immediately , also ordering his accusers to state ˻ the charges ˼ against him before you .
44023031	" Therefore the soldiers , in accordance with ˻ their orders ˼ , took Paul and brought him to Antipatris during the night .
44023032	And on the next day they let the horsemen go on with him , and they returned to the barracks .
44023033	˻ The horsemen ˼ , when they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor , also presented Paul to him .
44023034	So after reading the letter and asking what province he was from , and learning that he was from Cilicia ,

44024001	And after five days the high priest Ananias came down with some elders and an attorney , a certain Tertullus , all of whom brought charges against Paul to the governor .
44024002	And when he had been summoned , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , “ We have experienced much peace through you , and reforms are taking place in this nation through your foresight .
44024003	Both in every way and everywhere we acknowledge this , most excellent Felix , with all gratitude .
44024004	But so that I may not impose on you for longer , I implore you to hear us briefly with your customary graciousness .
44024005	For we have found this man to be a public menace and one who causes riots among all the Jews throughout the Roman Empire and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes ,
44024006	who even attempted to desecrate the temple , and we arrested ˻ him ˼ .
44024008	When you yourself examine him you will be able to find out from ˻ him ˼ about all these things of which we are accusing him . ”
44024009	And the Jews also joined in the attack , asserting these things were so .
44024010	And when the governor gestured for him to speak , Paul replied , “ Because I know you have been a judge over this nation for many years , I defend myself cheerfully with respect to the things concerning myself .
44024011	You can ascertain that ˻ it has not been more than ˼ twelve days ˻ since ˼ I went up to Jerusalem to worship .
44024012	And neither did they find me arguing with anyone or making a crowd develop in the temple courts nor in the synagogues nor throughout the city .
44024013	Nor can they prove the things to you concerning which they are now accusing me .
44024014	But I do confess this to you , that according to the Way ( which they call a sect ) , so I worship the God of our fathers , believing all things that are in accordance with the law and that are written in the prophets ,
44024015	having a hope in God which these men also themselves await : that there is going to be a resurrection of both the righteous and the unrighteous .
44024016	˻ For this reason ˼ also I myself ˻ always ˼ do my best to have a clear conscience toward God and people .
