44024018	in which they found me purified in the temple courts , not with a crowd or with a disturbance .
44024019	But there are some Jews from Asia who ought to be present before you and bring charges against me , if they have anything against me ,
44024020	or these men themselves should say what crime they found when I stood before the Sanhedrin ,
44024021	other than concerning this one declaration that I shouted while standing there before them : ‘ I am being judged before you today concerning the resurrection of the dead ! ’ ”
44024022	But Felix , because he understood the facts concerning the Way more accurately , put them off , saying , “ When Lysias the military tribune comes down , I will decide ˻ your case ˼ . ”
44024023	He ordered the centurion for him to be guarded and to have some freedom , and in no way to prevent any of his own peoplefrom serving him .
44024024	And after some days , when Felix arrived with his wife Drusilla , who was Jewish , he sent for Paul and listened to him concerning faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	And while he was discussing about righteousness and self control and the judgment that is to come , Felix became afraid and replied , “ Go away for the present , and when I have an opportunity , I will summon you . ”
44024026	At the same time he was also hoping that money would be given to him by Paul . For this reason also he sent for him as often as possible and talked with him .
44024027	And when two years had passed , Felix received as successor Porcius Festus . And because he wanted to do a favor for the Jews , Felix left Paul behind ˻ as a prisoner ˼ .
44025001	Now when Festus set foot in the province , after three days he went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea .
44025002	And the chief priests and the most prominent men of the Jews brought charges against Paul to him , and were urging him ,
44025003	asking for a favor against him , that he summon him to Jerusalem , because they were preparing an ambush to do away with him along the way .
44025004	Then Festus replied that Paul was being kept at Caesarea , and he himself was about to go there in a short time .
44025005	So he said , “ Let those among you who are prominent go down with me , and if there is any wrong in the man , let them bring charges against him . ”
44025006	And after he had stayed among them not more than eight or ten days , he went down to Caesarea . On the next day he sat down on the judgment seat and gave orders for Paul to be brought .
44025007	And when he arrived , the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him , bringing many and serious charges that they were not able to prove ,
44025008	while Paul said in his defense , “ Neither against the law of the Jews nor against the temple nor against Caesar have I sinned with reference to anything ! ”
44025009	But Festus , because he wanted to do a favor for the Jews , answered and said to Paul , “ Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem to be tried before me there concerning these things ? ”
44025010	But Paul said , “ I am standing before the judgment seat of Caesar , where it is necessary for me to be judged . I have done no wrong to the Jews , as you also know very well .
44025011	If then I am doing wrong and have done anything deserving death , I am not trying to avoid dying . But if there is nothing true of the things which these people are accusing me , no one can give me up to them . I appeal to Caesar ! ”
44025012	Then Festus , after discussing this with his council , replied , “ You have appealed to Caesar — to Caesar you will go ! ”
44025013	Now after some days had passed , King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to welcome Festus .
44025014	And while they were staying there many days , Festus laid out the case against Paul to the king , saying , “ There is a certain man left behind by Felix as a prisoner ,
44025015	concerning whom when I was in Jerusalem the chief priests and the elders of the Jews presented evidence , asking for a sentence of condemnation against him .
44025016	To ˻ them ˼ I replied that it was not the custom of the Romans to give up any man before the one who had been accused met his accusers face to face and received an opportunity for a defense concerning the accusation .
44025017	Therefore , when they had assembled here , I made no delay ; on the next day I sat down on the judgment seat and gave orders for the man to be brought .
44025018	When they stood up , his accusers began bringing no charge concerning ˻ him ˼ of the evil deeds that I was suspecting ,
44025019	but they had some issues with him concerning their own religion , and concerning a certain Jesus , who was dead , whom Paul claimed to be alive .
44025020	And because I was at a loss with regard to the investigation concerning these things , I asked if he was willing to go to Jerusalem and to be judged there concerning these things .
44025021	But when Paul appealed that he be kept under guard for the decision of His Majesty the Emperor , I gave orders for him to be kept under guard until I could send him to Caesar . ”
44025022	So Agrippa said to Festus , “ I want to hear the man myself also . ” “ Tomorrow , ” he said , “ you will hear him . ”
44025023	So on the next day , Agrippa and Bernice came with great pageantry and entered into the audience hall , along with military tribunes and the most prominent men of the city . And when Festus gave the order , Paul was brought in .
44025024	And Festus said , “ King Agrippa and all who are present with us , you see this man about whom the whole population of the Jews appealed to me , both in Jerusalem and here , shouting that he must not live any longer .
44025025	But I understood that he had done nothing deserving death himself , and when this man appealed to His Majesty the Emperor , I decided to send him .
44025026	I do not have anything definite to write to my lord about ˻ him ˼ . Therefore I have brought him before you all — and especially before you , King Agrippa — so that after this preliminary hearing has taken place , I may have something to write .
44025027	For it seems unreasonable to me to send a prisoner and not to indicate the charges against him . ”
44026001	So Agrippa said to Paul , “ It is permitted for you to speak for yourself . ” Then Paul extended his hand and began to defend himself :
44026002	“ Concerning all the things of which I am accused by the Jews , King Agrippa , I consider myself fortunate that before you I am about to defend myself today ,
44026003	because you are especially acquainted with both all the customs and controversial questions with respect to the Jews . Therefore I beg you to listen to me with patience .
44026004	“ Now all the Jews know my manner of life from my youth , that had taken place from the beginning among my own people and in Jerusalem ,
44026005	having known me for a long time , if they are willing to testify , that in accordance with the strictest party of our religion I lived as a Pharisee .
44026006	And now I stand here on trial on the basis of hope in the promise made by God to our fathers ,
44026007	to which our twelve tribes hope to attain as they earnestly serve him night and day . Concerning this hope I am being accused by the Jews , O king !
44026008	Why is it thought incredible by you people that God raises the dead ?
44026009	Indeed , I myself thought it was necessary to do many things opposed to the name of Jesus the Nazarene ,
44026010	which I also did in Jerusalem , and not only did I lock up many of the saints in prison , having received authority from the chief priests , but also when they were being executed , I cast my vote against them .
44026011	And throughout all the synagogues I punished them often and tried to force them to blaspheme , and because I was enraged at them beyond measure , I was pursuing them even as far as to foreign cities .
44026012	In ˻ this activity ˼ I was traveling to Damascus with the authority and full power of the chief priests .
44026013	In the middle of the day along the road , O king , I saw a light from heaven , more than the brightness of the sun , shining around me and those who were traveling with me .
44026014	And when we had all fallen to the ground , I heard a voice saying to me in the Aramaic language , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? It is hard for you to kick against the goads ! ’
44026015	So I said , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ And the Lord said , ‘ I am Jesus whom you are persecuting .
44026016	But get up and stand on your feet , because for this reason I have appeared to you , to appoint you a servant and witness both to the things in which you saw me and to the things in which I will appear to you ,
44026017	rescuing you from the people and from the Gentiles to whom I am sending you ,
44026018	to open their eyes so that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God , so that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a share among those who are sanctified by faith in me . ’
44026019	“ Therefore , O King Agrippa , I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision ,
44026020	but to those in Damascus first , and in Jerusalem and all the region of Judea and to the Gentiles , I proclaimed that they should repent and turn to God , doing deeds worthy of repentance .
44026021	On account of these things the Jews seized me while I was in the temple courtsand were attempting to kill me .
44026022	Therefore I have experienced help from God until this day , and I stand here testifying to both small and great , saying nothing except what both the prophets and Moses have said were going to happen ,
44026023	that the Christ was to suffer and that as the first of the resurrection from the dead , he was going to proclaim light both to the people and to the Gentiles . ”
44026024	And as he was saying these things in his defense , Festus said with a loud voice , “ You are out of your mind , Paul ! Your great learning ˻ is driving ˼ you ˻ insane ˼ ! ”
44026025	But Paul said , “ I am not out of my mind , most excellent Festus , but am speaking words of truth and rationality .
44026026	For the king knows about these things , to whom also I am speaking freely , for I am not convinced that any of these things in any way has escaped his notice , because this ˻ was ˼ not ˻ done ˼ in a corner .
44026027	Do you believe the prophets , King Agrippa ? I know that you believe . ”
44026028	But Agrippa said to Paul , “ In a short time are you persuading me to become a Christian ? ”
44026029	And Paul replied , “ I pray to God , whether in a short time or in a long time , not only you but also all those who are listening to me today may become such people as I also am , except for these bonds ! ”
44026030	Both the king and the governor got up , and Bernice and those who were sitting with them .
44026031	And as they were going out , they were talking to one another , saying , “ This man is not doing anything deserving death or imprisonment . ”
44026032	And Agrippa said to Festus , “ This man could have been released if he had not appealed to Caesar . ”
44027001	And when it was decided that we would sail away to Italy , they handed over Paul and some other prisoners to a centurion ˻ named ˼ Julius of the Augustan Cohort .
44027002	And we went aboard a ship from Adramyttium that was about to sail to the places along the coast of Asia and put out to sea . Aristarchus , a Macedonian from Thessalonica , was with us .
44027003	And on the next day , we put in at Sidon . And Julius , treating Paul kindly , allowed him to go to his friends ˻ to be cared for ˼ .
44027004	And from there we put out to sea and sailed under the lee of Cyprus , because the winds were against us .
44027005	And after we had sailed across the open sea along Cilicia and Pamphylia , we put in at Myra in Lycia .
44027006	And there the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing for Italy and put us ˻ on board ˼ it .
44027007	And sailing slowly , in many days and with difficulty we came to Cnidus . Because the wind did not permit us to go further , we sailed under the lee of Crete off Salmone .
44027008	And sailing along its coast with difficulty , we came to a certain place called Fair Havens , near which was the town of Lasea .
44027009	And because considerable time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous because even the Fast was already over , Paul strongly recommended ,
44027010	saying to them , “ Men , I perceive that the voyage is going ˻ to end ˼ with disaster and great loss , not only of the cargo and the ship , but also of our lives ! ”
44027011	But the centurion was convinced even more by the shipmaster and the shipowner than by what was said by Paul .
44027012	And because the harbor was unsuitable for spending the winter in , the majority decided on a plan to put out to sea from there , if somehow they could arrive at Phoenix , a harbor of Crete facing toward the southwest and toward the northwest , to spend the winter there .
44027013	And when a southwest wind began to blow gently , because they thought they could accomplish their purpose , they weighed anchor and sailed close along Crete .
44027014	But not long afterward a wind like a hurricane , called the northeaster , rushed down from it .
44027015	And when the ship was caught and was not able to head into the wind , we gave way and were driven along .
44027016	And running under the lee of a certain small island called Cauda , we were able with difficulty to get the ship’s boat under control .
44027017	After hoisting ˻ it up ˼ , they made use of supports to undergird the ship . And because they were afraid lest they run aground on the Syrtis , they lowered the sea anchor and thus were driven along .
44027018	And because we were violently battered by the storm , on the next day˻ they began ˼ jettisoning the cargo ,
44027019	and on the third day they threw overboard the gear of the ship with their own hands .
44027020	But when neither sun nor stars appeared for many days , and with not a little bad weather confronting us , finally all hope was abandoned that we would be saved .
44027021	And because many were experiencing lack of appetite , at that time Paul stood up in their midst and said , “ Men , you ought to have followed my advice not to put out to sea from Crete , and thus avoided this damage and loss !
44027022	And now I urge you to cheer up , for there will be no loss of life from among you , but only of the ship .
44027023	For this night an angel of the God whose I am and whom I serve came to me ,
44027024	saying , ‘ Do not be afraid , Paul ! It is necessary for you to stand before Caesar , and behold , God has graciously granted you all who are sailing with you . ’
44027025	Therefore keep up your courage , men , for I believe God that it will be like this — according to ˻ the ˼ way it was told to me .
44027026	But it is necessary that we run aground on some island . ”
44027027	And when the fourteenth night had come , as we were being driven in the Adriatic Sea about the middle of the night , the sailors suspected ˻ they were approaching some land ˼ .
44027028	And taking soundings , they found twenty fathoms . So going on a little further and taking soundings again , they found fifteen fathoms .
44027029	And because they were afraid lest somewhere we run aground against rough places , they threw down four anchors from the stern and prayed for day to come .
44027030	And when the sailors were seeking to escape from the ship and were lowering the ship’s boat into the sea , pretending as if they were going to lay out anchors from the bow ,
44027031	Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers , “ Unless these men remain with the ship , you cannot be saved ! ”
44027032	Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the ship’s boat and let it fall away .
44027033	And until the day was about to come , Paul was urging them all to take some food , saying , “ Today is the fourteenth day you have waited anxiously , and you have continued without eating , having taken nothing .
44027034	Therefore I urge you to take some food , for this is necessary for your preservation . For not a hair from your head will be lost . ”
44027035	And after he said these things and took bread , he gave thanks to God in front of them all , and after breaking it , he began to eat .
44027036	So they all were encouraged and partook of food themselves .
44027037	( Now we were in all two hundred seventy six persons on the ship . )
44027038	And when they had eaten their fill of food , they lightened the ship by throwing the wheat into the sea .
44027039	Now when day came , they did not recognize the land , but they noticed a certain bay having a beach , onto which they decided to run the ship ashore if they could .
44027040	And slipping the anchors , they left them in the sea , at the same time loosening the ropes of the steering oars . And hoisting the foresail to the wind that was blowing , they held course for the beach .
44027041	But falling into a place of crosscurrents , they ran the ship aground . And the bow stuck fast and stayed immovable , but the stern was being broken up by the force of the waves .
44027042	Now the plan of the soldiers was that they would kill the prisoners lest any escape by swimming away ,
44027043	but the centurion , because he wanted to save Paul , prevented them ˻ from doing what they intended ˼ , and gave orders that those who were able to swim should jump in first to get to the land ,
44027044	and then the rest , some of whom floated on planks and some of whom on anything that was from the ship . And in this way all were brought safely to the land .
44028001	And after we were brought safely through , then we found out that the island was called Malta .
44028002	And the local inhabitants showed ˻ extraordinary ˼ kindness to us , for they lit a fire and welcomed us all , because of the rain that had begun and because of the cold .
44028003	And when Paul had gathered a large number of sticks and was placing them on the fire , a viper came out because of the heat and fastened itself on his hand .
44028004	And when the local people saw the creature hanging from his hand , they began saying to one another , “ Doubtless this man is a murderer whom , although he was rescued from the sea , Justice has not permitted to live ! ”
44028005	He , in turn , shook off the creature into the fire and suffered no harm .
44028006	But they were expecting that he was going to swell up or suddenly to fall down dead . So after they had waited for a long time and saw nothing unusual happen to him , they changed their minds and began saying that he was a god .
44028007	Now in the regions around that place were fields belonging to the chief official of the island , ˻ named ˼ Publius , who welcomed us and entertained us hospitably for three days .
44028008	And it happened that the father of Publius was lying down , afflicted with fever and dysentery . Paul went to ˻ him ˼ and after praying , he placed his hands on him and healed him .
44028009	And after this had taken place , the rest of those on the island who had diseases were coming and being healed also .
44028010	They also honored us with many honors , and when we were putting out to sea , they gave us the things˻ we needed ˼ .
44028011	Now after three months we put out to sea in a ship that had wintered at the island , an Alexandrian one˻ with the twin gods Castor and Pollux as its insignia ˼ .
44028012	And putting in at Syracuse , we stayed there three days .
44028013	From there we got underway and arrived at Rhegium , and after one day a south wind came up and on the second day we came to Puteoli ,
44028014	where we found brothers , and were implored to stay with them seven days . And in this way we came to Rome .
44028015	And from there the brothers , when they heard the news about us , came to meet us as far as the Forum of Appius and Three Taverns . When he saw them , Paul gave thanks to God and took courage .
44028016	And when we entered into Rome , Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier who was guarding him .
44028017	Now it happened that after three days , he called together those who were the most prominent of the Jews . And when they had assembled , he said to them , “ Men and brothers , although I had done nothing against our people or the customs of our fathers , from Jerusalem I was delivered as a prisoner into the hands of the Romans ,
44028018	who , when they had examined me , were wanting to release me , because there was no basis for an accusation worthy of death with me .
44028019	But because the Jews objected , I was forced to appeal to Caesar ( not as if I had any charge to bring against my own people ) .
44028020	Therefore for this reason I have requested to see you and to speak with you , for because of the hope of Israel I am wearing this chain ! ”
44028021	And they said to him , “ We have received no letters about you from Judea , nor has any of the brothers come and reported or spoken anything evil about you .
44028022	But we would like to hear from you what you think , for concerning this sect it is known to us that it is spoken against everywhere . ”
44028023	And when they had set a day with him , many more came to him at his lodging place , to whom he was explaining from early in the morning until evening , testifying about the kingdom of God and attempting to convince them about Jesus from both the law of Moses and the prophets .
44028024	And some were convinced by what was said , but others refused to believe .
44028025	So being in disagreement with one another , they began to leave after Paul made one statement : “ The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through the prophet Isaiah to your fathers ,
44028026	saying , ‘ Go to this people and say , “ ˻ You will keep on hearing ˼ and will never understand , and ˻ you will keep on seeing ˼ and will never perceive .
44028027	For the heart of this people has become dull , and with their ears they hear with difficulty , and they have shut their eyes , lest they see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , and understand with their heart , and turn , and I would heal them . ” ’
44028028	Therefore let it be known to you that this salvation of God has been sent to the Gentiles . They also will listen ! ”
44028030	So he stayed two whole years in his own rented house , and welcomed all who came to him ,
44028031	proclaiming the kingdom of God and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness , without hindrance .
45001001	Paul , a slave of Christ Jesus , called to be an apostle , set apart for the gospel of God ,
45001002	which he promised previously through his prophets in the holy scriptures ,
45001003	concerning his Son , who was born ˻ a descendant ˼ of David according to the flesh ,
45001004	who was declared Son of God in power according to ˻ the Holy Spirit ˼ by the resurrection from the dead of Jesus Christ our Lord ,
45001005	through whom we have received grace and apostleship for the obedience of faith among all the Gentiles on behalf of his name ,
45001006	among whom you also are the called of Jesus Christ .
45001007	To all those in Rome who are loved by God , called to be saints . Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
45001008	First , I give thanks to my God through Jesus Christ for all of you , because your faith is being proclaimed in the whole world .
45001009	For God , whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son , is my witness , how constantly I make mention of you ,
45001010	always asking in my prayers if somehow now at last I may succeed to come to you in the will of God .
45001011	For I desire to see you , in order that I may impart some spiritual gift to you , in order to strengthen you ,
45001012	that is , to be encouraged together with you through ˻ our mutual faith ˼ , both yours and mine .
45001013	Now I do not want you to be ignorant , brothers , that often I intended to come to you , and was prevented until now , in order that I might have some fruit among you also , just as also among the rest of the Gentiles .
45001014	I am under obligation both to Greeks and to barbarians , both to the wise and to the foolish .
45001015	Thus ˻ I am eager ˼ to proclaim the gospel also to you who are in Rome .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the gospel , for it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes , to the Jew first and also to the Greek .
45001017	For the righteousness of God is revealed in it from faith to faith , just as it is written , “ But the one who is righteous by faith will live . ”
45001018	For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all impiety and unrighteousness of people , who suppress the truth in unrighteousness ,
45001019	because what can be known about God is evident among them , for God made it clear to them .
45001020	For from the creation of the world , his invisible attributes , both his eternal power and deity , are discerned clearly , being understood in the things created , so that they are without excuse .
45001021	For although they knew God , they did not honor him as God or give thanks , but they became futile in their reasoning , and their senseless hearts were darkened .
45001022	Claiming to be wise , they became fools ,
45001023	and exchanged the glory of the immortal God with the likeness of an image of mortal human beings and birds and quadrupeds and reptiles .
45001024	Therefore God gave them over in the desires of their hearts to immorality , that their bodies would be dishonored among themselves ,
45001025	who exchanged the truth of God with a lie , and worshiped and served the creation rather than the Creator , who is blessed for eternity . Amen .
45001026	Because of this , God gave them over to degrading passions , for their females exchanged the natural relations for those contrary to nature ,
45001027	and likewise also the males , abandoning the natural relations with the female , were inflamed in their desire toward one another , males with males committing the shameless deed , and receiving in themselves the penalty that was necessary for their error .
45001028	And just as they did not see fit ˻ to recognize God ˼ , God gave them over to a debased mind , to do the things that are not proper ,
45001029	being filled with all unrighteousness , wickedness , greediness , malice , full of envy , murder , strife , deceit , malevolence . They are gossipers ,
45001030	slanderers , haters of God , insolent , arrogant , boasters , contrivers of evil , disobedient to parents ,
45001031	senseless , faithless , unfeeling , unmerciful ,
45001032	who , although they know the requirements of God , that those who do such things are worthy of death , not only do they do the same things , but also they approve of those who do them .
45002001	Therefore you are without excuse , O man , every one of you who passes judgment . For in that which you pass judgment on someone else , you condemn yourself , for you who are passing judgment are doing the same things .
45002002	Now we know that the judgment of God is according to truth against those who do such things .
45002003	But do you think this , O man who passes judgment on those who do such things , and who does the same things , that you will escape the judgment of God ?
45002004	Or do you despise the wealth of his kindness and forbearance and patience , not knowing that the kindness of God leads you to repentence ?
45002005	But because of your stubbornness and unrepentant heart , you are storing up for yourself wrath in the day of wrath and of the revelation of the righteous judgment of God ,
45002006	who will reward each one according to his works :
45002007	to those who , by perseverance in good work , seek glory and honor and immortality , eternal life ,
45002008	but to those who act from selfish ambition and who disobey the truth , but who obey unrighteousness , wrath and anger .
45002009	There will be affliction and distress for every ˻ human being ˼ who does evil , of the Jew first and of the Greek ,
45002010	but glory and honor and peace to everyone who does good , to the Jew first and to the Greek .
45002011	For there is no partiality with God .
45002012	For as many as have sinned without law will also perish without law , and as many as have sinned under the law will be judged by the law .
45002013	For it is not the hearers of the law who are righteous in the sight of God , but the doers of the law will be declared righteous .
45002014	For whenever the Gentiles , who do not have the law , do by nature the things of the law , these , although they do not have the law , are a law to themselves ,
45002015	who show the work of the law written on their hearts , their conscience bearing witness and their thoughts one after another accusing or even defending them
45002016	on the day when God judges the secret things of people , according to my gospel , through Christ Jesus .
45002017	But if you call yourself a Jew and rely on the law and boast in God
45002018	and know his will and approve the things that are superior , because you are instructed by the law ,
45002019	and are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind , a light of those in darkness ,
45002020	an instructor of the foolish , a teacher of the immature , having the embodiment of knowledge and of the truth in the law .
45002021	Therefore , the one who teaches someone else , do you not teach yourself ? The one who preaches not to steal , do you steal ?
45002022	The one who says not to commit adultery , do you commit adultery ? The one who abhors idols , do you rob temples ?
45002023	Who boast in the law , by the transgression of the law you dishonor God !
45002024	For just as it is written , “ The name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you . ”
45002025	For circumcision is of value if you do the law , but if you should be a transgressor of the law , your circumcision has become uncircumcision .
45002026	Therefore , if the uncircumcised person follows the requirements of the law , will not his uncircumcision be credited for circumcision ?
45002027	And the uncircumcised person by nature who carries out the law will judge you who , though provided with ˻ the precise written code ˼ and circumcision are a transgressor of the law .
45002028	For the Jew is not ˻ one outwardly ˼ , nor is circumcision ˻ outwardly ˼ , in the flesh .
45002029	But the Jew ˻ is one inwardly ˼ , and circumcision is of the heart , by the Spirit , not by the letter , whose praise is not from people but from God .
45003001	Therefore , what is the advantage of the Jew , or what is the use of circumcision ?
45003002	Much in every way . For first , that they were entrusted with the oracles of God .
45003003	˻ What is the result ˼ if some refused to believe ? Their unbelief will not nullify the faithfulness of God , will it ?
45003004	May it never be ! But let God be true but every human being a liar , just as it is written , “ In order that you may be justified in your words , and may prevail when you are judged . ”
45003005	But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God , what shall we say ? God , who inflicts wrath , is not unjust , is he ? ( I am speaking according to a human perspective . )
45003006	May it never be ! For otherwise , how will God judge the world ?
45003007	But if by my lying , the truth of God abounded to his glory , why am I also still condemned as a sinner ?
45003008	And why not ( as we are slandered , and as some affirm that we say ) , “ Let us do evil , in order that good may come of it ? Their condemnation is just !
45003009	What then ? Do we have an advantage ? Not at all . For we have already charged both Jews and Greeks are all under sin ,
45003010	just as it is written , “ There is no one righteous , not even one ;
45003011	there is no one who understands ; there is no one who seeks God .
45003012	All have turned aside together ; they have become worthless ; There is no one who practices kindness ; there is not even one .
45003013	Their throat is an opened grave ; they deceive with their tongues ; the venom of asps is under their lips ,
45003014	whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness .
45003015	Their feet are swift to shed blood ;
45003016	destruction and distress are in their paths ,
45003017	and they have not known the way of peace .
45003018	The fear of God is not before their eyes . ”
45003019	Now we know that whatever the law says , it speaks to those under the law , in order that every mouth may be closed and the whole world may become accountable to God .
45003020	For by the works of the law ˻ no person will be declared righteous ˼ before him , for through the law comes knowledge of sin .

45004001	What then shall we say that Abraham , our ancestor according to the flesh , has found ?
45004002	For if Abraham was justified by works , he has something to boast about , but not before God .
45004003	For what does the scripture say ? “ And Abraham believed God , and it was credited to him for righteousness . ”
45004004	Now to the one who works , his pay is not credited according to grace , but according to his due .
45004005	But to the one who does not work , but who believes in the one who justifies the ungodly , his faith is credited for righteousness ,
45004006	just as David also speaks about the blessing of the person to whom God credits righteousness apart from works :
45004007	“ Blessed are they whose lawless deeds have been forgiven , and whose sins are covered over .
45004008	Blessed is the person against whom the Lord will never count sin . ”
45004009	Therefore , is this blessing for ˻ those who are circumcised ˼ , or also for ˻ those who are uncircumcised ˼ ? For we say , “ Faith was credited to Abraham for righteousness . ”

45004011	And he received the sign of circumcision as a seal of the righteousness by faith which he had˻ while uncircumcised ˼ , so that he could be the father of all who believe ˻ although they are uncircumcised ˼ , so that righteousness could be credited to them also ,
45004012	and the father ˻ of those who are circumcised ˼ to those who are not only from the circumcision , but who also follow in the footsteps of the faith of our father Abraham ˻ which he had while uncircumcised ˼ .
45004013	For the promise to Abraham or to his descendants , that he would be heir of the world , was not through the law , but through the righteousness by faith .
45004014	For if those of the law are heirs , faith is rendered void and the promise is nullified .
45004015	For the law produces wrath , but where there is no law , neither is there transgression .
45004016	Because of this , it is by faith , in order that it may be according to grace , so that the promise may be secure to all the descendants , not only to those of the law , but also to those of the faith of Abraham , who is the father of us all
45004017	( just as it is written , “ I have made you the father of many nations ” ) before God , in whom he believed , the one who makes the dead alive and who calls the things that are not as though they are ,
45004018	who against hope believed in hope , so that he became the father of many nations , according to what was said , “ so will your descendants be . ”
45004019	And not being weak in faith , he considered his own body already as good as dead , because he was approximately a hundred years old , and the deadness of Sarah’s womb .
45004020	And he did not waver in unbelief at the promise of God , but was strengthened in faith , giving glory to God
45004021	and being fully convinced that what he had promised , he was also able to do .
45004022	Therefore , indeed , it was credited to him for righteousness .
45004023	But it was not written for the sake of him alone that it was credited to him ,

45004025	who was handed over on account of our trespasses , and was raised up in the interest of our justification .
45005001	Therefore , because we have been declared righteous by faith , we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ ,
45005002	through whom also we have obtained access by faith into this grace in which we stand , and we boast in the hope of the glory of God .
45005003	And not only this , but we also boast in our afflictions , because we know that affliction produces patient endurance ,
45005004	and patient endurance , proven character , and proven character , hope ,
45005005	and hope does not disappoint , because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts through the Holy Spirit who was given to us .
45005006	For while we were still helpless , yet at the proper time Christ died for the ungodly .
45005007	For only rarely will someone die on behalf of a righteous person ( for on behalf of a good person possibly someone might even dare to die ) ,
45005008	but God demonstrates his own love for us , in that while we were still sinners , Christ died for us .
45005009	Therefore , by much more , because we have been declared righteous now by his blood , we will be saved through him from the wrath .
45005010	For if , while we were enemies , we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son , by much more , having been reconciled , we will be saved by his life .
45005011	And not only this , but also we are boasting in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , through whom we have now received the reconciliation .
45005012	Because of this , just as sin entered into the world through one man , and death through sin , so also death spread to all people because all sinned .
45005013	For until the law , sin was in the world , but sin is not charged to one’s account when there is no law .
45005014	But death reigned from Adam until Moses even over those who did not sin in the likeness of the transgression of Adam , who is a type of the one who is to come .
45005015	˻ But the gift is not like the trespass ˼ , for if by the trespass of the one , the many died , by much more did the grace of God and the gift by the grace of the one man , Jesus Christ , multiply to the many .
45005016	And the gift is not as through the one who sinned , for on the one hand , judgment from the one sinled to condemnation , but the gift , from many trespasses , led to justification .
45005017	For if by the trespass of the one man , death reigned through the one man , much more will those who receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one , Jesus Christ .
45005018	Consequently therefore , as through one trespass came condemnation to all people , so also through one righteous deed came justification of life to all people .
45005019	For just as through the disobedience of the one man , the many were made sinners , so also through the obedience of the one , the many will be made righteous .
45005020	Now the law came in as a side issue , in order that the trespass could increase , but where sin increased , grace was present in greater abundance ,
45005021	so that just as sin reigned in death , so also grace would reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
45006001	What therefore shall we say ? Shall we continue in sin , in order that grace may increase ?
45006002	May it never be ! How can we who died to sin still live in it ?
45006003	Or do you not know that as many as were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death ?
45006004	Therefore we have been buried with him through baptism into death , in order that just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father , so also we may live ˻ a new way of life ˼ .
45006005	For if we have become identified with him in the likeness of his death , certainly also we will be identified with him in the likeness of his resurrection ,
45006006	knowing this , that our old man was crucified together with him , in order that the body of sin may be done away with , that we may no longer be enslaved to sin .
45006007	For the one who has died has been freed from sin .
45006008	Now if we died with Christ , we believe that we will also live with him ,
45006009	knowing that Christ , because he has been raised from the dead , is going to die no more , death no longer being master over him .
45006010	For that death he died , he died to sin once and never again , but that life he lives , he lives to God .
45006011	So also you , consider yourselves to be dead to sin , but alive to God in Christ Jesus .
45006012	Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body , so that you obey its desires ,
45006013	and do not present your members to sin as instruments of unrighteousness , but present yourselves to God as those who are alive from the dead , and your members to God as instruments of righteousness .
45006014	For sin will not be master over you , because you are not under law , but under grace .
45006015	What then ? Shall we sin because we are not under law but under grace ? May it never be !
45006016	Do you not know that to whomever you present yourselves as slaves for obedience , you are slaves to whomever you obey , whether sin , leading to death , or obedience , leading to righteousness ?
45006017	But thanks be to God that you were slaves of sin , but you have obeyed from the heart the pattern of teaching to which you were entrusted ,
45006018	and having been set free from sin , you became enslaved to righteousness .
45006019	( I am speaking in human terms because of the weakness of your flesh . ) For just as you presented your members as slaves to immorality and lawlessness , leading to lawlessness , so now present your members as slaves to righteousness , leading to sanctification .
45006020	For when you were slaves of sin , you were free with respect to righteousness .
45006021	Therefore what sort of fruit did you have then , about which you are now ashamed ? For the end of those thingsis death .
45006022	But now , having been set free from sin and having been enslaved to God , you have your fruit leading to sanctification , and its end is eternal life .
45006023	For the compensation due sin is death , but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45007001	Or do you not know , brothers ( for I am speaking to those who know the law ) , that the law is master of a person for as long a time as he lives ?
45007002	For the married woman is bound by law to her husband while he lives , but if her husband dies , she is released from the law of the husband .
45007003	Therefore as a result , if she belongs to another man while her husband is living , she will be called an adulteress . But if her husband dies , she is free from the law , so that she is not an adulteress if she belongs to another man .
45007004	So then , my brothers , you also were brought to death with respect to the law through the body of Christ , so that you may belong to another , to the one who was raised from the dead , in order that we may bear fruit for God .
45007005	For when we were in the flesh , sinful desires were working through the law in our members , to bear fruit for death .
45007006	But now we have been released from the law , because we have died to that by which we were bound , so that we may serve in newness of the Spirit and not in oldness of the letter of the law .
45007007	What then shall we say ? Is the law sin ? May it never be ! But I would not have known sin except through the law , for I would not have known covetousness if the law had not said , “ Do not covet . ”
45007008	But sin , seizing an opportunity through the commandment , produced in me all kinds of covetousness . For apart from the law , sin is dead .
45007009	And I was alive once , apart from the law , but when the commandment came , sin sprang to life
45007010	and I died , and this commandment which was to lead to life was found with respect to me to lead to death .
45007011	For sin , seizing the opportunity through the commandment , deceived me and through it killed me .
45007012	So then , the law is holy , and the commandment is holy and righteous and good .
45007013	Therefore , did that which is good become death to me ? May it never be ! Rather it was sin , in order that it might be recognized as sin , producing death through what is good for me , in order that sin might become sinful to an extraordinary degree through the commandment .
45007014	For we know that the law is spiritual , but I am fleshly , ˻ sold into slavery to sin ˼ .
45007015	For what I am doing I do not understand , because what I want to do , this I do not practice , but what I hate , this I do .
45007016	But if what I do not want to do , this I do , I agree with the law that it is good .
45007017	But now I am no longer the one doing it , but sin that lives in me .
45007018	For I know that good does not live in me , that is , in my flesh . For the willing is present in me , but the doing of the good is not .
45007019	For the good that I want to do , I do not do , but the evil that I do not want to do , this I do .
45007020	But if what I do not want to do , this I am doing , I am no longer the one doing it , but sin that lives in me .
45007021	Consequently , I find the principle with me , the one who wants to do good , that evil is present with me .
45007022	For I joyfully agree with the law of God in my inner person ,
45007023	but I observe another law in my members , at war with the law of my mind and making me captive to the law of sin that exists in my members .
45007024	Wretched man that I am ! Who will rescue me from this body of death ?
45007025	But thanks be to God through Jesus Christ our Lord ! So then , I myself with my mind am enslaved to the law of God , but with my flesh I am enslaved to the law of sin .
45008001	Consequently , there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus .
45008002	For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set you free from the law of sin and death .
45008003	For what was impossible for the law , in that it was weak through the flesh , God did . By sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and concerning sin , he condemned sin in the flesh ,
45008004	in order that the requirement of the law would be fulfilled in us , who do not live according to the flesh but according to the Spirit .
45008005	For those who are living according to the flesh are intent on the things of the flesh , but those who are living according to the Spirit are intent on the things of the Spirit .
45008006	For the mindset of the flesh is death , but the mindset of the Spirit is life and peace ,
45008007	because the mindset of the flesh is enmity toward God , for it is not subjected to the law of God , for it is not able to do so ,
45008008	and those who are in the flesh are not able to please God .
45008009	But you are not in the flesh but in the Spirit , if indeed the Spirit of God lives in you . But if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ , this person ˻ does not belong to him ˼ .
45008010	But if Christ is in you , the body is dead because of sin , but the Spirit is life because of righteousness .
45008011	And if the Spirit of the one who raised Jesus from the dead lives in you , the one who raised Christ from the dead will also make alive your mortal bodies through his Spirit who lives in you .
45008012	So then , brothers , we are obligated not to the flesh , to live according to the flesh .
45008013	For if you live according to the flesh , you are going to die , but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body , you will live .
45008014	For all those who are led by the Spirit of God , these are sons of God .
45008015	For you have not received a spirit of slavery leading to fear again , but you have received the Spirit of adoption , by whom we cry out , “ Abba ! Father ! ”
45008016	The Spirit himself confirms to our spirit that we are children of God ,
45008017	and if children , also heirs — heirs of God and fellow heirs with Christ , if indeed we suffer together with him so that we may also be glorified together with him .
45008018	For I consider that the sufferings of the present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory that is about to be revealed to us .
45008019	For the eagerly expecting creation awaits eagerly the revelation of the sons of God .
45008020	For the creation has been subjected to futility , not willingly , but because of the one who subjected it , in hope
45008021	that the creation itself also will be set free from its servility to decay , into the glorious freedom of the children of God .
45008022	For we know that the whole creation groans together and suffers agony together until now .
45008023	Not only this , but we ourselves also , having the first fruits of the Spirit , even we ourselves groan within ourselves while we await eagerly our adoption , the redemption of our body .
45008024	For in hope we were saved , but hope that is seen is not hope , for who hopes for what he sees ?
45008025	But if we hope for what we do not see , we await it eagerly with patient endurance .
45008026	And likewise also , the Spirit helps us in our weakness , for we do not know how to pray as one ought , but the Spirit himself intercedes for uswith unexpressed groanings .
45008027	And the one who searches our hearts knows what the mindset of the Spirit is , because he intercedes on behalf of the saints according to the will of God .
45008028	And we know that all things work together for good for those who love God , for those who are called according to his purpose ,
45008029	because those whom he foreknew , he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son , so that he should be the firstborn among many brothers .
45008030	And those whom he predestined , these he also called , and those whom he called , these he also justified , and those whom he justified , these he also glorified .
45008031	What then shall we say about these things ? If God is for us , who can be against us ?
45008032	Indeed , he who did not spare his own Son , but gave him up for us all , how will he not also , together with him , freely give us all things ?
45008033	Who will bring charges against God’s elect ? God is the one who justifies .
45008034	Who is the one who condemns ? Christ Jesus is the one who died , and more than that , who was raised , who is also at the right hand of God , who also intercedes for us .
45008035	Who will separate us from the love of Christ ? Will affliction or distress or persecution or hunger or lack of sufficient clothing or danger or the sword ?
45008036	Just as it is written , “ On account of you we are being put to death the whole day long ; we are considered as sheep for slaughter . ”
45008037	No , but in all these things we prevail completely through the one who loved us .
45008038	For I am convinced that neither death , nor life , nor angels , nor rulers , nor things present , nor things to come , nor powers ,
45008039	nor height , nor depth , nor any other created thing , will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45009001	I am telling the truth in Christ — I am not lying ; my conscience bears witness to me in the Holy Spirit —
45009002	that my grief is great and there is constant distress in my heart .
45009003	For I could wish myself to be accursed from Christ for the sake of my brothers , my fellow countrymen according to the flesh ,
45009004	who are Israelites , to whom belong the adoption , and the glory , and the covenants , and the giving of the law , and the temple service , and the promises ,
45009005	to whom belong the patriarchs , and from whom is the Christ according to human descent , who is God over all , blessed ˻ forever ˼ ! Amen .
45009006	But it is not as if the word of God had failed . For not all those who are descended from Israel are truly Israel ,
45009007	nor are they all children because they are descendants of Abraham , but “ In Isaac will your descendants be named . ”
45009008	That is , it is not the children ˻ by human descent ˼ who are children of God , but the children of the promise are counted as descendants .
45009009	For the statement of the promise is this : “ At this time I will return and ˻ Sarah will have ˼ a son . ”
45009010	And not only this , but also when Rebecca conceived children by one man , Isaac our father —
45009011	for although they had not yet been born , or done anything good or evil , in order that the purpose of God according to election might remain ,
45009012	not by works but by the one who calls — it was said to her , “ The older will serve the younger , ”
45009013	just as it is written , “ Jacob I loved , but Esau I hated . ”
45009014	What then shall we say ? There is no injustice with God , is there ? May it never be !
45009015	For to Moses he says , “ I will have mercy on whomever I have mercy , and I will have compassion on whomever I have compassion . ”
45009016	Consequently therefore , ˻ it does not depend on the ˼ one who wills or on the one who runs , but on God who shows mercy .
45009017	For the scripture says to Pharaoh , “ For this very reason I have raised you up , so that I may demonstrate my power in you , and so that my name might be proclaimed in all the earth . ”
45009018	Consequently therefore , he has mercy on whomever he wishes , and he hardens whomever he wishes .
45009019	Therefore you will say to me , “ Why then does he still find fault ? For who has resisted his will ?
45009020	On the contrary , O man , who are you who answers back to God ? Will what is molded say to the one who molded it , “ Why did you make me like this ” ?
45009021	Or does the potter not have authority over the clay , to make from the same lump a vessel that is for ˻ honorable use ˼ and one that is for ˻ ordinary use ˼ ?
45009022	And what if God , wanting to demonstrate his wrath and to make known his power , endured with much patience vessels of wrath prepared for destruction ?
45009023	And he did so in order that he could make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy that he prepared beforehand for glory ,
45009024	us whom he also called , not only from the Jews but also from the Gentiles ?
45009025	As he also says in Hosea , “ I will call those who were not my people , ‘ My people , ’ and those who were not loved , ‘ Loved . ’
45009026	And it will be in the place where it was said to them , ‘ You are not my people , ’ there they will be called ‘ sons of the living God . ’ ”
45009027	And Isaiah cries out concerning Israel , “ Even if the number of the sons of Israel is like the sand of the sea , the remnant will be saved ,
45009028	˻ for the Lord will execute his sentence thoroughly and decisively ˼ upon the earth . ”
45009029	And just as Isaiah foretold , “ If the Lord of hosts had not left us descendants , we would have become like Sodomand would have resembled Gomorrah . ”
45009030	What then shall we say ? That the Gentiles , who did not pursue righteousness , attained righteousness — even the righteousness that is by faith .
45009031	But Israel , pursuing the law of righteousness , did not attain to the law .
45009032	Why that ? Because they did not pursue it by faith , but as if by works . They stumbled over the ˻ stone that causes people to stumble ˼ ,
45009033	just as it is written , “ Behold , I am laying in Zion ˻ a stone that causes people to stumble ˼ , and ˻ a rock that causes them to fall ˼ , and the one who believes in him will not be put to shame . ”
45010001	Brothers , the desire of my heart and my prayer to God on behalf of them is for their salvation .
45010002	For I testify about them that they have a zeal for God , but not according to knowledge .
45010003	For ignoring the righteousness of God , and seeking to establish their own righteousness , they did not subject themselves to the righteousness of God .
45010004	For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes .
45010005	For Moses writes about the righteousness that is from the law : “ The person who does these things will live by them . ”
45010006	But the righteousness from faith speaks like this : “ Do not say in your heart , ‘ Who will ascend into heaven ? ’ ” ( that is , to bring Christ down ) ,
45010007	or “ Who will descend into the abyss ? ” ( that is , to bring Christ up from the dead ) .
45010008	But what does it say ? “ The word is near to you , in your mouth and in your heart ” ( that is , the word of faith that we proclaim ) ,
45010009	that if you confess with your mouth “ Jesus is Lord ” and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead , you will be saved .
45010010	For with the heart one believes , resulting in righteousness , and with the mouth one confesses , resulting in salvation .
45010011	For the scripture says , “ Everyone who believes in him will not be put to shame . ”
45010012	For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek , for the same Lordis Lord of all , who is rich to all who call upon him .
45010013	For “ everyone who calls upon the name of the Lord will be saved . ”
45010014	How then will they call upon him in whom they have not believed ? And how will they believe in him about whom they have not heard ? And how will they hear about him without one who preaches to them ?
45010015	And how will they preach , unless they are sent ? Just as it is written , “ How timely are the feet of those who bring good news of good things . ”
45010016	But not all have obeyed the good news , for Isaiah says , “ Lord , who has believed our report ? ”
45010017	Consequently , faith comes by hearing , and hearing through the word about Christ .
45010018	But I say , they have not heard , have they ? On the contrary , “ Their voice has gone out to all the earth , and their words to the ends of the inhabited world . ”
45010019	But I say , Israel did not know , did they ? First , Moses says , “ I will provoke you to jealousy by those who are not a nation ; by a senseless nation I will provoke you to anger . ”
45010020	And Isaiah is very bold and says , “ I was found by those who did not seek me ; I became known to those who did not ask for me . ”
45010021	But about Israel he says , “ The whole day long I held out my handsto a disobedient and resistant people . ”
45011001	Therefore I say , God has not rejected his people , has he ? May it never be ! For I also am an Israelite , from the descendants of Abraham , of the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God has not rejected his people , whom he foreknew ! Or do you not know , in the passage about Elijah , what the scripture says — how he appeals to God against Israel ?
45011003	“ Lord , they have killed your prophets , they have torn down your altars , and I alone am left , and they are seeking my life ! ”
45011004	But what does the divine response say to him ? “ I have left for myself seven thousand people who have not bent the knee to Baal . ”
45011005	So in this way also at the present time , there is a remnant ˻ selected by grace ˼ .
45011006	But if by grace , it is no longer by works , for otherwise grace would no longer be grace .
45011007	What then ? What Israel was searching for , this it did not obtain . But the elect obtained it , and the rest were hardened ,
45011008	just as it is written , “ God gave them a spirit of stupor , eyes that do not see and ears that do not hear , until this very day . ”
45011009	And David says , “ Let their table become a snare and a trap , and a cause for stumbling and a retribution to them ;
45011010	let their eyes be darkened so that they do not see , and cause their backs to bend ˻ continually ˼ . ”
45011011	I say then , they did not stumble so that they fell , did they ? May it never be ! But by their trespass , salvation has come to the Gentiles , in order to provoke them to jealousy .
45011012	And if their trespass means riches for the world and their loss means riches for the Gentiles , how much more will their fullness mean ?
45011013	Now I am speaking to you Gentiles . Therefore , inasmuch as I am apostle to the Gentiles , I promote my ministry ,
45011014	if somehow I may provoke my people to jealousy and save some of them .
45011015	For if their rejection means the reconciliation of the world , what will their acceptance mean except life from the dead ?
45011016	Now if the first fruits are holy , so also is the whole batch of dough , and if the root is holy , so also are the branches .
45011017	Now if some of the branches were broken off , and you , although you were a wild olive tree , were grafted in among them and became a sharer of the root of the olive tree’s richness ,
45011018	do not boast against the branches . But if you boast against them , you do not support the root , but the root supports you .
45011019	Then you will say , “ Branches were broken off in order that I could be grafted in . ”
45011020	Well said ! They were broken off because of unbelief , but you stand firm because of faith . Do not think arrogant thoughts , but be afraid .
45011021	For if God did not spare the ˻ natural ˼ branches , perhaps he will not spare you either .
45011022	See , then , the kindness and severity of God : severity upon those who have fallen , but upon you the kindness of God — if you continue in his kindness , for otherwise you also will be cut off .
45011023	And those also , if they do not persist in unbelief , will be grafted in , because God is able to graft them in again .
45011024	For if you were cut off from what is by nature a wild olive tree , and contrary to nature were grafted into a cultivated olive tree , how much more will these who are ˻ natural branches ˼ be grafted into their own olive tree ?
45011025	For I do not want you to be ignorant , brothers , of this mystery , so that you will not be wise in your own sight , that a partial hardening has happened to Israel , until the full number of the Gentiles has come in ,
45011026	and so all Israel will be saved , just as it is written , “ The deliverer will come out of Zion ; he will turn away ungodliness from Jacob .
45011027	And this is the covenant from me with themwhen I take away their sins . ”
45011028	With respect to the gospel , they are enemies for your sake , but with respect to election , they are dearly loved for the sake of the fathers .
45011029	For the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable .
45011030	For just as you formerly were disobedient to God , but now have been shown mercy because of the disobedience of these ,
45011031	so also these have now been disobedient for your mercy , in order that they also may now be shown mercy .
45011032	For God confined them all in disobedience , in order that he could have mercy on them all .
45011033	Oh , the depth of the richesand the wisdom and the knowledge of God ! How unsearchable are his judgmentsand how incomprehensible are his ways !
45011034	“ For who has known the mind of the Lord , or who has been his counselor ?
45011035	Or who has given in advance to him , and it will be paid back to him ? ”
45011036	For from him and through him and to him are all things . To him be glory for eternity ! Amen .
45012001	Therefore I exhort you , brothers , through the mercies of God , to present your bodies as a living sacrifice , holy and pleasing to God , which is your reasonable service .
45012002	And do not be conformed to this age , but be transformed by the renewal of your mind , so that you may approve what is the good and well-pleasing and perfect will of God .
45012003	For by the grace given to me I say to everyone who is among you not to think more highly of yourself than what one ought to think , but to think ˻ sensibly ˼ , as God has apportioned a measure of faith to each one .
45012004	For just as in one body we have many members , but all the members do not have the same function ,
45012005	in the same way we who are many are one body in Christ , and ˻ individually ˼ members of one another ,
45012006	but having different gifts according to the grace given to us : if it is prophecy , according to the proportion of his faith ;
45012007	if it is service , by service ; if it is one who teaches , by teaching ;
45012008	if it is one who exhorts , by exhortation ; one who gives , with sincerity ; one who leads , with diligence ; one who shows mercy , with cheerfulness .
45012009	Love must be without hypocrisy . Abhor what is evil ; be attached to what is good ,
45012010	being devoted to one another in brotherly love , esteeming one another more highly in honor ,
45012011	not lagging in diligence , being enthusiastic in spirit , serving the Lord ,
45012012	rejoicing in hope , enduring in affliction , being devoted to prayer ,
45012013	contributing to the needs of the saints , pursuing hospitality .
45012014	Bless those who persecute you , bless and do not curse them .
45012015	Rejoice with those who rejoice ; weep with those who weep .
45012016	Think the same thing toward one another ; ˻ do not think arrogantly ˼ , but associate with the lowly . Do not be wise ˻ in your own sight ˼ .
45012017	Pay back no one evil for evil . Take thought for what is good in the sight of all people .
45012018	If it is possible on your part , be at peace with all people .
45012019	Do not take revenge yourselves , dear friends , but give place to God’s wrath , for it is written , “ Vengeance is mine , I will repay , ” says the Lord .
45012020	But “ if your enemy is hungry , feed him ; if he is thirsty , give him something to drink ; for by doing this , you will heap up coals of fire upon his head . ”
45012021	Do not be overcome by evil , but overcome evil with good .
45013001	Let every person be subject to the governing authorities , for there is no authority except by God , and those that exist are put in place by God .
45013002	So then , the one who resists authority resists the ordinance which is from God , and those who resist will receive condemnation on themselves .
45013003	For rulers are not a cause of terror for a good deed , but for bad conduct . So do you want not to be afraid of authority ? Do what is good , and you will have praise from it ,
45013004	for it is God’s servant to you for what is good . But if you do what is bad , be afraid , because it does not bear the sword to no purpose . For it is God’s servant , the one who avenges for punishment on the one who does what is bad .
45013005	Therefore it is necessary to be in subjection , not only because of wrath but also because of conscience .
45013006	For because of this you also pay taxes , for the authorities are servants of God , busily engaged in this very thing .
45013007	Pay to everyone what is owed : pay taxes to whom taxes are due ; pay customs duties to whom customs duties are due ; pay respect to whom respect is due ; pay honor to whom honor is due .
45013008	Owe nothing to anyone , except to love one another , for the one who loves someone else has fulfilled the law .
45013009	For the commandments , “ You shall not commit adultery , you shall not commit murder , you shall not steal , you shall not covet , ” and if there is any other commandment , are summed up in this statement : “ You shall love your neighbor as yourself . ”
45013010	Love does not commit evil against a neighbor . Therefore love is the fulfillment of the law .
45013011	And do this because you know the time , that it is already the hour for you to wake up from sleep . For our salvation is nearer now than when we believed .
45013012	The night is far gone , and the day has drawn near . Therefore let us lay aside the deeds of darkness and put on the weapons of light .
45013013	Let us live decently , as in the day , not in carousing and drunkenness , not in sexual immorality and licentiousness , not in strife and jealousy .
45013014	But put on the Lord Jesus Christ and do not make provision for the desires of the flesh .
45014001	Now receive the one who is weak in faith , but not for quarrels about opinions .
45014002	One believes he may eat all things , but the one who is weak eats only vegetables .
45014003	The one who eats must not despise the one who does not eat , and the one who does not eat must not judge the one who eats , because God has accepted him .
45014004	Who are you , who passes judgment on the domestic slave belonging to someone else ? To his own master he stands or falls , and he will stand , for the Lord is able to make him stand .
45014005	For one person prefers one day over another day , and another person regards every day alike . Each one must be fully convinced in his own mind .
45014006	The one who is intent on the day is intent on it for the Lord , and the one who eats eats for the Lord , because he is thankful to God , and the one who does not eat does not eat for the Lord , and he is thankful to God .
45014007	For none of us lives for himself and none dies for himself .
45014008	For if we live , we live for the Lord , and if we die , we die for the Lord . Therefore whether we live or whether we die , we are the Lord’s .
45014009	For Christ died and became alive again for this reason , in order that he might be Lord of both the dead and the living .
45014010	But why do you judge your brother ? Or also , why do you despise your brother ? For we will all stand before the judgment seat of God .
45014011	For it is written , “ As I live , says the Lord , every knee will bow to me , and every tongue will praise God . ”
45014012	So then , each one of us will give an account concerning himself to God .
45014013	Therefore , let us no longer pass judgment on one another , but rather decide this : not to place a cause for stumbling or a temptation before a brother .
45014014	I know and am convinced in the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean of itself , except to the one who considers something to be unclean ; to that person it is unclean .
45014015	For if because of food , your brother is grieved , you are no longer living according to love . Do not destroy by your food that person for whom Christ died .
45014016	Therefore do not let your good be slandered .
45014017	For the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking , but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit .
45014018	For the one who serves Christ in this wayis well-pleasing to God and approved by people .
45014019	So then , let us pursue ˻ what promotes peace ˼ and ˻ what edifies one another ˼ .
45014020	Do not destroy the work of God on account of food . All thingsare clean , but it is wrong for the person ˻ who eats and stumbles in the process ˼ .
45014021	It is good not to eat meat or to drink wine or to do anything by which your brother stumbles .
45014022	The faith that you have , have with respect to yourself before God . Blessed is the one who does not pass judgment on himself by what he approves .
45014023	But the one who doubts is condemned if he eats , because he does not do so from faith , and everything that is not from faith is sin .
45015001	But we who are strong ought to bear the weaknesses of the weak , and not to please ourselves .
45015002	Let each one of us please his neighbor for his good , for the purpose of edification .
45015003	For even Christ did not please himself , but just as it is written , “ The insults of those who insult you have fallen on me . ”
45015004	For whatever was written beforehand was written for our instruction , in order that through patient endurance and through the encouragement of the scriptures we may have hope .
45015005	Now may the God of patient endurance and of encouragement grant you ˻ to be in agreement ˼ with one another , in accordance with Christ Jesus ,
45015006	so that with one mind you may glorify with one mouth the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45015007	Therefore accept one another , just as Christ also has accepted you , to the glory of God .
45015008	For I say , Christ has become a servant of the circumcision on behalf of the truth of God , in order to confirm the promises to the fathers ,
45015009	and that the Gentiles may glorify God for his mercy , just as it is written , “ Because of this , I will praise you among the Gentiles , and I will sing praise to your name . ”
45015010	And again it says , “ Rejoice , Gentiles , with his people . ”
45015011	And again , “ Praise the Lord , all the Gentiles , and let all the peoples praise him . ”
45015012	And again Isaiah says , “ The root of Jesse will come , even the one who rises to rule over the Gentiles ; in him the Gentiles will put their hope . ”
45015013	Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing , so that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit .
45015014	Now I myself also am convinced about you , my brothers , that you yourselves also are full of goodness , filled with all knowledge , able also to instruct one another .
45015015	But I have written to you more boldly on some points , so as to remind you again because of the grace that has been given to me by God ,
45015016	with the result that I am a servant of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles , serving the gospel of God as a priest , in order that the offering of the Gentiles may become acceptable , sanctified by the Holy Spirit .
45015017	Therefore I have a reason for boasting in Christ Jesus regarding the things concerning God .
45015018	For I will not dare to speak about anything except that which Christ has accomplished through me , resulting in the obedience of the Gentiles by word and deed ,
45015019	by the power of signs and wonders , by the power of the Spirit of God , so that from Jerusalem and traveling around as far as Illyricum I have fully proclaimed the gospel of Christ .
45015020	And so , having as my ambition to proclaim the gospel where Christ has not been named , in order that I will not build on the foundation belonging to someone else ,
45015021	but just as it is written , “ Those to whom it was not announced concerning him will see , and those who have not heard will understand . ”
45015022	For this reason also I was hindered many times from coming to you ,
45015023	and now , no longer having a place in these regions , but having a desire for many years to come to you
45015024	whenever I travel to Spain . For I hope while I am passing through to see you and to be sent on my way by you , whenever I have first enjoyed your company for a while .
45015025	But now I am traveling to Jerusalem , serving the saints .
45015026	For Macedonia and Achaia were pleased to make some contribution for the poor among the saints in Jerusalem .
45015027	For they were pleased to do so , and they are obligated to them . For if the Gentiles have shared in their spiritual things , they ought also to serve them in material things .
45015028	Therefore , after I have accomplished this and sealed this fruit for delivery to them , I will depart by way of you for Spain ,
45015029	and I know that when I come to you , I will come in the fullness of the blessing of Christ .
45015030	Now I exhort you , brothers , through our Lord Jesus Christ and through the love of the Spirit , to contend along with me in your prayers on my behalf to God ,
45015031	that I may be rescued from those who are disobedient in Judea , and my ministry in Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints ,
45015032	so that , coming to you with joy by the will of God , I may rest with you .
45015033	Now may the God of peace be with all of you . Amen .
45016001	Now I commend to you Phoebe our sister , who is also a servant of the church in Cenchrea ,
